abdomen / abdominal.definicao: Area between the chest and the hips that contains the stomach, small intestine, large intestine, liver, gallbladder, pancreas, and spleen.

adhesion.definicao: A band of scar-like tissue that forms between two surfaces inside the body, connecting tissues or organs which are not normally connected.

adnexa.definicao: Conjoined, subordinate, or associated anatomic parts.

allergen multi-box screen.definicao: Allergen screen for immunoglobin E. A "box" is a category test, such as of trees or mold. If a tree category allergy is detected, then an allergen-specific test would be done to determine which tree.

allergen-specific antigen.definicao: Allergen screen for immunoglobin E. This is an individual test for a specific allergy.

amniotic fluid.definicao: Clear liquid that surrounds and protects the fetus throughout pregnancy.

anesthesiologist.definicao: Specialist who administers anesthetics (drugs or other agents to prevent or relieve pain during medical procedures) to a patient before being treated.

angiography.definicao: A test that shows how blood moves through the blood vessels and heart. It uses x-rays and the injection of a fluid called a contrast agent that can be seen on the x-rays.

angioplasty.definicao: A procedure used to open blocked or narrowed arteries, most commonly by inserting a thin tube, or catheter, into the affected artery and inflating a balloon.

anteroposterior.definicao: In x-ray imaging, taken or viewed from front to back (as opposed to from back to front, which is posteroanterior).

aortic aneurysm.definicao: Swelling of the main blood vessel leaving the heart (aorta), usually representing an underlying weakness in the wall of the aorta at that location.

aortic valve.definicao: A valve on the left side of the heart that acts as a one-way gate, opening to allow blood to leave the left ventricle and closing to prevent blood from leaking back into that ventricle.

appendectomy.definicao: Surgical removal of the vermiform appendix.

arthroscopy.definicao: A procedure where a surgeon makes a small cut in the skin and inserts tiny lenses, lighting, and other instruments to diagnose or repair joint problems.

average direct pay price.definicao: The average price a self-pay patient will pay when in the hospital for an inpatient stay or outpatient procedure. Arrangements can be made to pay over time.

average prompt pay price.definicao: The average price a Self Pay patient will pay when paid-in-full in advance of an inpatient stay or outpatient procedure.

average total charges.definicao: The estimated average total charges a person will experience when in the hospital for an inpatient stay or outpatient procedure.

basic metabolic panel.definicao: A group of eight tests used as a general screening tool.

bilateral.definicao: Affecting both sides of the body. For example, bilateral breast cancer is cancer occurring in both breasts at the same time.

bilirubin.definicao: Bilirubin is a substance formed when hemoglobin breaks down. A bilirubin test measures the amount of bilirubin in the blood.

blood type abo.definicao: A blood test that categorizes blood into one of four types: A, B, AB or O.

blood type rh.definicao: A blood test that checks for the presence or absence of the Rh antigen, also called the Rh factor.

brain lesion.definicao: A destructive change in brain tissue, such as a wound, injury or inflammation.

carotid artery.definicao: One of two major blood vessels found on either side of the neck. The carotid arteries supply blood to the brain.

carpal tunnel.definicao: Passageway in the wrist through which nerves and the flexor muscles of the hands pass.

cautery.definicao: Instrument or substance used to destroy tissue by burning it with a hot iron, electric current, caustic, or by freezing it.

c difficile.definicao: Clostridium difficile: an intestinal bacteria that can be detected by a culture.

cervical spine.definicao: The part of the spine located in the neck and consisting of the top seven vertebrae.

cervix.definicao: Relating to the lower, narrow part of the uterus (womb) located between the bladder and the rectum. It forms a canal that opens into the vagina, which leads to the outside of the body. The cervix is the narrow lower part of the womb. It is often referred to the neck of the womb or the entrance to the womb. 'Cervical' can refer to your neck as well – such as in your cervical vertebrae that make up the neck area of your spine.

cesarean section.definicao: Surgical procedure to deliver a baby through an incision in the lower abdomen and uterus.

charge specialist.definicao: Contact a John C. Lincoln Health Network Charge Specialist.

colon.definicao: The large intestine; a muscular tube that is 5 to 6 feet long. It compacts and moves solid waste.

colonoscopy.definicao: A procedure to see inside the colon, using a long, lighted flexible tube mounted with a tiny camera.

comorbidity.definicao: Existing simultaneously with and usually independently of another medical condition.

comprehensive metabolic panel.definicao: A group of 14 tests used as a general screening tool.

contrast.definicao: A substance that is opaque to x-rays. When administered, it allows a radiologist to examine the organ or tissue it fills.

coronary.definicao: Pertaining to the arteries that supply blood to the heart.

coronary bypass.definicao: Surgical procedure in which a healthy blood vessel is transplanted from another part of the body into the heart to replace or bypass a diseased vessel.

coronary catheterization.definicao: Minimally invasive procedure that accesses coronary circulation and blood-filled chambers of the heart using a catheter. It is performed for both diagnostic and interventional (treatment) purposes.

cpk.definicao: Creatine phosphokinase: an enzyme present in various tissue types.

cpt code.definicao: Current Procedural Terminology (CPT) is a code used by all hospitals, physicians and insurance companies to identify a specific type of service or procedure.

creatinine.definicao: A waste product created by muscle metabolism. Doctors sometimes test creatinine levels to examine kidney function.

ct scan.definicao: Computed Tomography (CT) is a non-invasive, diagnostic procedure that uses a series of x-rays to show a cross-sectional view of the inside of the body.

cystocele.definicao: Condition in which weakened pelvic muscles cause the base of the bladder to drop from its usual position down into the vagina.

debride.definicao: To cleanse by surgical removal of lacerated or contaminated tissue.

diagnostic x-ray.definicao: Diagnostic test that uses invisible electromagnetic energy beams to produce images of internal tissues, bones, and organs onto film.

drg code.definicao: Diagnosis-Related Group (DRG) is a code system used to classify hospital cases for the purpose of reimbursements from programs such as Medicare.

drug-eluting stent.definicao: A stent is a small, lattice-shaped, metal tube inserted permanently into an artery to hold it open so that blood can flow through it. Drug-eluting stents are stents that contain drugs that reduce the chance the arteries becoming blocked.

duodenum.definicao: The upper part of the small intestine.

edema.definicao: Swelling caused by abnormal accumulation of fluid in tissues.

embolism.definicao: Blockage of a blood vessel by a clot (an embolus) that has traveled from another part of the body.

endarterectomy.definicao: Surgical removal of plaque or blood clots in an artery.

endoscopic.definicao: Relating to a procedure that uses an endoscope, a long, flexible, lighted tube, to diagnose or treat a condition.

enterocele.definicao: Prolapse of the small intestine through the top of the vagina.

esophageal sphincter.definicao: A circular band of muscle which connects the esophagus to the stomach.

estimated average charge.definicao: The estimated average charge is an approximate calculation of the total hospital charges for a specific service or procedure at a Purple.org facility. It is not a fixed quote. An estimated average charge does not include other fees from your surgeon, anesthesiologist, pathologist or radiologist.

ethmoid sinus.definicao: Sinus of the meatuses (passageways) of the nasal cavity (behind the bridge of the nose).

extremity.definicao: That part of a limb that is farthest from the torso.

fallopian tubes.definicao: Thin tubes that extend from each side of the uterus, toward the ovaries, as a passageway for eggs and sperm.

ferritin.definicao: A protein that captures and stores iron.

fetus / fetal.definicao: Unborn baby from the eighth week after fertilization until delivery.

fibroids.definicao: Non-cancerous growths in, on, or within the walls of the uterus.

fibular.definicao: Relating to the fibula (calf bone), the outer, narrower, and smaller of the two bones of the lower leg, extending from the knee to the ankle.

fluoroscopy.definicao: A test that gives moving images of the inside of the body; could be likened to an x-ray movie.

forearm.definicao: The part of the arm between the elbow and the wrist.

free t4.definicao: A test to help evaluate thyroid function.

fusion.definicao: Correction of an unstable part of the spine by joining two or more vertebrae. Usually done surgically, but sometimes done by traction or immobilization.

gastroenterostomy.definicao: Surgical creation of an opening between the stomach wall and the small intestines; performed when the normal opening has been eliminated.

gc pcr.definicao: A test to identify the bacteria Neisseria Gonorrhoeae, responsible for the sexually transmitted disease gonorrhea.

glucose test.definicao: A test to measure the amount of a type of sugar in the blood.

glycated hemoglobin test (hgb a1c).definicao: A test to measure the amount of glucose concentration over a period of time.

hemoglobin.definicao: The oxygen-carrying substance that gives red blood cells their color.

hematocrit.definicao: This test measures the amount of space (volume) red blood cells occupy in the blood.

hernia.definicao: Protrusion of part of an organ through the muscle that surrounds it. This is a condition where a muscle has a weak spot which lets your insides bulge out through it. It's fixed in an operation.

hiv.definicao: Human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) is a virus that attacks the immune system, making it difficult for the body to fight infection and disease. Abbreviation for human immunodeficiency virus, the virus that leads to acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS). HIV damages immune cells so that they are no longer able to fight off other infections.

hysterectomy.definicao: An operation to remove a woman’s uterus.

image post-processing.definicao: Manipulating the information from the CT scan to better visualize the part of the body that is being examined.

incarcerated / strangulated.definicao: Compressed, constricted, or obstructed so as to cut off the flow of blood or other fluid.

incisional.definicao: Relating to the surgically cutting of or into body tissues or organs.

infusion.definicao: The slow injection of a fluid into a vein or tissues.

inguinal.definicao: Relating to or near the groin.

inpatient procedure.definicao: A procedure that requires the patient to stay at the hospital at least one night.

insurance (commercial/private).definicao: An employer provided or personally purchased insurance policy that provides coverage for health care services. Deductibles, coinsurance, out-of-pocket limits and types of coverage vary.

internal fixation.definicao: The stabilization of broken bones by direct fixation to one another with surgical wires, pins, screws, or plates.

ionized calcium test.definicao: A test to measure the amount of calcium that is not bound to protein in the blood.

ischemia.definicao: Inadequate blood supply to an organ or part of the body.

laparoscopic.definicao: Relating to the use of a viewing tube with a lens or camera (and a light on the end), which is inserted through a small incision in the abdomen to examine the contents of the abdomen and remove tissue samples.

lap-band laparoscopic.definicao: (Laparoscopic Gastric Banding) A common bariatric procedure which involves the placement of an adjustable silicone elastic band on the upper part of the stomach typically using a laparoscopic technique.

lead test.definicao: A test to measure the amount of lead present in the blood.

ligation.definicao: The tying of a duct or blood vessel with a ligature to prevent bleeding during surgery.

lipase.definicao: An enzyme secreted by the pancreas that helps the body break down fats.

lipid panel.definicao: A group of tests used to measure lipids, or fatty substances, in the body. The panel includes total cholesterol, types of cholesterol and triglycerides.

liver/hep function panel.definicao: A group of tests used to detect and monitor liver disease or damage.

lumbar.definicao: Relating to or near the lower back between the ribs and the hipbones.

lumbosacral.definicao: Relating to or near the small of the back and the back part of the pelvis between the hips.

lymph node(s).definicao: Small organs located in the channels of the lymphatic system which store special cells to trap bacteria or cancer cells traveling through the lymph vessels.

magnesium level.definicao: A test to measure the amount of magnesium in the blood.

mammography.definicao: Diagnostic procedure to detect breast tumors by the use of X-rays.

mastectomy.definicao: Surgical removal of all or part of the breast.

meniscus.definicao: Crescent-shaped cartilage between the upper end of the tibia (shin bone) and the femur (thigh bone).

microalbumin test.definicao: A test that measures the amount of albumin in the urine. Albumin is a protein that is produced in the liver and released into the blood.

mono test.definicao: A test for mononucleosis, an infectious disease caused by a virus.

mra (magnetic resonance angiogram).definicao: Diagnostic procedure that uses a combination of a large magnet, radiofrequencies and a computer to produce detailed images of the blood vessels.

mri (magnetic resonance imaging).definicao: Diagnostic procedure that uses a combination of large magnets, radiofrequencies, and a computer to produce detailed images of organs and structures within the body.

nasal septum.definicao: Partition of bone and cartilage between the nasal cavities.

natriuretic peptide/brain natriuretic pe.definicao: A test for natriuretic peptide or brain natriuretic peptide, a hormone that is an indicator of how efficiently the heart is working.

Traduções.pt: teste de peptídeo natriurético/peptídeo natriurético cerebral (bnp) *
Traduções.es: Prueba de péptido natriurético/péptido natriurético cerebral (bnp) *

neonate.definicao: A newborn infant. The medical way of referring to a baby who is under one month old.

obstetric panel.definicao: A group of blood tests performed before and during a pregnancy.

occult blood screen.definicao: A test to detect blood in the stool by placing a small sample of stool on a chemically treated card, pad or wipe.

other charges.definicao: Estimated average hospital charges do not include physicians fees such as your surgeon, anesthesiologist, pathologist or radiologist. They will bill you separately for their services.

outpatient location.definicao: A non-hospital surgical facility dedicated to providing outpatient surgery and procedures.

outpatient procedure.definicao: A procedure that does not require the patient to stay overnight at the hospital.

pathologist.definicao: Physician who identifies diseases by studying cells and tissues under a microscope.

pcr.definicao: Polymerase chain reaction, a technique used in a number of laboratory tests.

pelvic floor.definicao: The sling of muscles that support the intestines and bladder, as well as the uterus in women. Weak or damaged pelvic floor muscles can cause incontinence or diminished sexual pleasure, among other problems.

pelvis.definicao: Basin-shaped structure that supports the spinal column and contains the sacrum, coccyx, and hip bones (ilium, pubis, and ischium). The bones in your lower body that protect the bladder and in women, the womb.

peritoneal.definicao: Relating to the peritoneum, or the lining of the abdominal cavity.

pet.definicao: A noninvasive, painless procedure that combines the technology from a positron emission tomography (PET) and a computed tomography (CT) to create one highly powerful diagnostic imaging system.

phosphorous.definicao: Phosphorus is a component of DNA and RNA and is necessary for all living cells.

pleurisy.definicao: Inflammation of the pleura that is characterized by sudden onset, painful and difficult respiration and exudation of fluid or fibrinous material into the pleural cavity.

potassium.definicao: Potassium is an essential component necessary for all living cells.

procedure code.definicao: A code used by all hospitals, physicians and insurance companies to identify a specific type of service or procedure.

prolapsing.definicao: A condition that occurs when an internal organ slips from its normal position.

prosthesis.definicao: An artificial device such as a hearing aid, artificial joint, or dentures that substitutes for a missing body part.

protime (inr).definicao: A test to measure the clotting tendency of blood.

psa.definicao: A prostate-specific antigen screen to evaluate the possibility of prostate cancer. Abbreviation for prostate-specific antigen, a protein produced by the prostate. Elevated levels may indicate the presence of cancer, benign prostatic hyperplasia, or prostatitis.

ptt.definicao: Partial thromboplastin time measures the time it takes the blood to clot.

pulmonary embolisms.definicao: Blockage of the pulmonary (lung) artery by foreign matter or by a blood clot.

quality of care.definicao: Learn about HonorHealth's quality of care.

radiological marker.definicao: Placing a needle into the area that may be surgically removed.

radiologist.definicao: Physician specializing in the field of radiology (x-rays or other imaging technologies, such as ultrasound and magnetic resonance imaging) to diagnose or treat disease. Sometimes, doctors use special machines to take pictures of the inside your body. The pictures that they take look very strange, and radiologists help to look at them, so that the doctors can find out what's going on.

rectocele.definicao: A weakening of the vaginal wall that allows the rectum to bulge into the vagina.

recurrent.definicao: To occur again; reappearance of cancer cells at the same site or in another location.

reducible.definicao: Permitting of reduction; capable of being reduced.

reduction of fracture.definicao: Correction or realignment of a broken bone.

retroperitoneal.definicao: Relating to the area behind the abdominal cavity, including: kidneys, bladder, and portions of the duodenum, pancreas, and colon.

rotator cuff.definicao: A group of tendons and muscles used to raise the arm from the side and rotating the shoulder.

roux-en-y laparoscopic.definicao: A form of gastric bypass surgery that can also be performed as an open procedure when necessary.

sacral.definicao: Referring to the sacrum, the wedge-shaped bone consisting of five fused vertebrae forming the posterior part of the pelvis.

scrotum.definicao: Bag of skin that holds the testicles. The scrotum is part of the male genitals. It is a soft muscular pouch that sits underneath the penis. It holds the testicles, which are two small sacs that produce and hold sperm and hormones.

sed rate.definicao: Shorthand for erythrocyte sedimentation rate—a test involving red blood cells used to check for different infections, inflammations, and cancers.

septicemia.definicao: A condition in which disease-causing organisms have spread to the bloodstream from an infection elsewhere in the body. Also known as blood poisoning.

shunt.definicao: A device inserted into the body to redirect the flow of blood or other fluid from one area to another.

skin lesion.definicao: Destructive change in skin tissue, such as a wound, injury, or inflammation.

spinal canal.definicao: The passageway in successive vertebrae through which the spinal cord passes.

stoma.definicao: Mouth like surgical opening on the surface of the body to create access to an internal organ. This is an opening that is created in a patient’s side so that waste which cannot be removed naturally (either through the colon or by the kidneys) can be expelled.

thin prep pap screen.definicao: A type of test used to screen for cervical cancer.

Traduções.es: pantalla delgada de preparación de papanicolaou *

throat culture.definicao: A test to detect and identify a bacterial, fungal or viral infection in the throat.

thyroid gland.definicao: A two-lobed gland located in the front of the neck below the larynx (voice box). It secretes hormones that help regulate the body's metabolism and calcium balance.

tibia.definicao: The large bone of the calf, or shinbone.

transurethral.definicao: Through the urethra (narrow channel through which urine passes from the bladder out of the body).

transvaginal.definicao: Through the vagina (the passageway through which fluid passes out of the body during menstrual periods).

tsh.definicao: Thyroid stimulating hormone is a hormone secreted by the pituitary gland that is used to regulate thyroid function. Abbreviation for thyroid-stimulating hormone, a hormone secreted into the bloodstream by the pituitary gland that stimulates the thyroid gland. Doctors measure levels of TSH to determine whether a person’s thyroid hormone levels are normal.

ultrasound.definicao: A painless, noninvasive imaging method that uses high-frequency sound waves.

umbilical.definicao: Referring to the rope-like cord connecting the fetus to the placenta. The umbilical cord contains two arteries and a vein, which carry oxygen and nutrients to the fetus and waste products away from the fetus.

urinalysis.definicao: A physical or chemical test of the urine.

urine pregnancy test.definicao: A test to look for human chorionic gonadotropin (hCG), also called the pregnancy hormone. This hormone is only present during pregnancy.

vascular.definicao: Having to do with blood vessels and circulation.

vena cava.definicao: Either of two large veins that return oxygen-depleted blood to the right atrium of the heart.

ventral.definicao: Toward or on or near the belly.

vitamin b12.definicao: Vitamin B12 is necessary for creating new red blood cells, maintaining nervous system health, and growth and development in children.

x-ray.definicao: X-rays allow the doctors to look inside your body, from the outside. The x-ray machine takes a picture, which helps them to see what's going on inside your body. The x-ray beams pass through soft tissue so looks black in the picture, but gets stopped by anything solid, such as bone, which shows white.

acute medical unit.definicao: The first point of entry into hospital for patients who have been referred as emergencies by their GP or who require admission from the A&E department.

adhd.definicao: The abbreviation for attention deficit hyperactivity disorder.

afc.definicao: Agenda for Change. The main pay system for NHS staff, except doctors, dentists and senior managers.

agenda for change.definicao: The main pay system for staff in the NHS, except doctors, dentists and senior managers. Abbreviated to AfC and also know as NHS Terms and Conditions of Service.

aneurysms.definicao: Caused by dilation of a blood vessel, and can lead to rupture and death.

angioedema.definicao: The swelling of the deeper layers of the skin, caused by a build-up of fluid.

aorta.definicao: The large artery emerging from the heart's left ventricle that distributes blood to the body.

aspiration.definicao: Breathing in a foreign object. Also, the process of suctioning fluid, tissue, or other substances from the body.

autoimmune disease.definicao: A disease in which the immune system mistakenly identifies healthy tissues and organs as threats and responds by attacking and destroying them.

bariatric surgery.definicao: One of several types of weight loss surgery performed on people who are dangerously overweight, to restrict or reduce food intake and/or absorption.

biopsy.definicao: The removal of a small piece of tissue from the body for examination under a microscope.

brachytherapy.definicao: Treatment in which a surgeon implants seeds or pellets of radioactive material in the body to destroy cancer cells.

bronchoscopy.definicao: Examination of the airways using a bronchoscope (a flexible or rigid tube with a small camera and light at the end). A test where the doctor can look inside your lungs using a flexible tube with a camera and light on the end. You’ll usually have this test under a general anaesthetic, so you won’t know what is happening.

cardiac arrest.definicao: The sudden cessation of contractions capable of circulating blood to the body and brain. Also called sudden cardiac arrest. Cardiac arrest usually occurs as a result of a rapid ventricular rhythm (ventricular tachycardia) or a chaotic one (ventricular fibrillation). Death occurs within minutes unless cardiopulmonary resuscitation and defibrillation are available.

cardiopulmonary.definicao: Pertaining to the heart and lungs.

cardiopulmonary resuscitation (cpr).definicao: Involves the administration of live-saving chest compressions to someone who is not breathing or who has suffered a cardiac arrest.

cardiovascular.definicao: Pertaining to the heart and blood vessels.

catheter.definicao: A thin tube that is inserted into the body to provide or drain fluids, or to carry tiny surgical instruments and cameras in minimally invasive surgeries.

cct.definicao: Certificate of completion of training. Confirms that a doctor has completed an approved training programme in the UK and is eligible for entry onto the GP register or the specialist register. The Certificate of Eligibility for Specialist Registration (CESR) provides an alternative route to the specialist register for those doctors who have not followed a traditional training programme, but who may have gained the same skills as CCT holders.

certificate of completion of training.definicao: Confirms that a doctor has completed an approved training programme in the UK and is eligible for entry onto the GP register or the specialist register. Abbreviated to CCT.

Traduções.es: certificado de finalización de la formación *

chemotherapy.definicao: The use of chemicals to treat disease; often used to destroy cancer cells.

cieh.definicao: Chartered Institute for Environmental Health. An independent organisation representing the interests of the environmental health profession.

clinical audit.definicao: A process that has been defined as "a quality improvement process that seeks to improve patient care and outcomes through systematic review of care against explicit criteria and the implementation of change."

clinical commissioning group.definicao: A group of GPs repsonsible for designing local health services in England. Abbreviated to CCG.

Traduções.es: grupo de puesta en marcha clínica *

clinical effectiveness.definicao: A measure of the extent to which a particular treatment or intervention works.

cognitive behavioural therapy.definicao: A talking therapy that can help you manage your problems by changing the way you think and behave. Abbreviated to CBT.

colorectal.definicao: Relating to the colon or rectum.

competition ratio.definicao: Competition ratios tell you how many applications were received relative to the number of places available.

core medical training.definicao: Core medical training was replaced in Autumn 2019 by internal medicine training

corporate governance.definicao: A system that incorporates processes to minimise all risks in an organisation.

corticosteroid.definicao:
Corticosteroids are a class of steroid hormones that are produced in the adrenal cortex of vertebrates, as well as the synthetic analogues of these hormones

    Similar Terms:           Corticosteroid

corticosteroid drugs.definicao: Similar to corticosteroid hormones that are produced by the adrenal glands, which are small glands at the top of the kidney. Often known as steroids, they are prescribed for a variety of conditions, via tablets, injection, inhalers, creams and so on.

croup.definicao: A common condition in babies and young children resulting in narrowing and inflammation of the airways that causes hoarseness, noisy breathing and a cough. It is usually viral.

ct scans.definicao: Computerised tomography scan. Uses X-rays and a computer to create detailed images of the inside of the body. Sometimes referred to as a CAT scan or computed tomography scan.

cyclotron.definicao: A particle accelerator that accelerates charged particles in a spiralling motion, which are then extracted from the accelerator to be used for many different purposes, for example in medical or research activities.

data mining.definicao: The process of extracting information from a set of data and putting it into a format that can be easily understood for further use.

developmental language disorder.definicao: A lifelong condition that significantly affects how someone understands what is said to them and /or how they express themselves

differential diagnosis.definicao: A series of potential diagnoses that could explain the symptoms a patient is experiencing, which can then potentially lead to the correct diagnosis.

dna.definicao: Deoxyribonucleic acid. The hereditary material in humans and almost all other organisms. An abbreviation for deoxyribonucleic acid, the substance in cells that contains the genetic instructions that direct their function.

doppler.definicao: Doppler effect (or the Doppler shift) is the change in frequency or wavelength of a wave.

elective.definicao: A period of time (often 6-12 weeks) spent away from a medical degree on a placement, often overseas. A wide range of other health-related degree courses can also include an elective, such as dentistry, nursing, physiotherapy and pharmacy. When you have a test or operation planned for the future, the doctors may call it an ‘elective’ test or operation. This just means that it’s not an emergency and that it is planned to happen at some point in the future.

electro-convulsive therapy.definicao: A standard psychiatric treatment in which seizures are electrically induced in patients to provide relief from psychiatric illnesses. Formerly known as electroshock therapy.

electrocardiograms.definicao: A test that checks for problems with the electrical activity of the heart.

electroencephalogram (eeg).definicao: A test to record the electrical activity of the brain – used for diagnosis and monitoring of certain conditions that affect the brain.

endocrine system.definicao:
Your endocrine system includes eight major glands throughout your body, such as the thyroid gland, pituitary gland, adrenal gland, and pancreas.

    Similar Terms:           endocrine system This consists of the glands around the body which release hormones – chemical messengers that switch on and off processes within the body. The master gland is the pituitary gland, deep inside your brain, which sends chemical messages to the other glands, telling them to produce other hormones.

endometrial ablation.definicao: A medical procedure that is used to remove (ablate) or destroy the endometrial lining of a uterus.

endoscope.definicao: A thin, flexible tube equipped with a light and camera that is used to see inside an organ or body cavity.

endoscopy.definicao: Inserting a flexible tube equipped with a light and camera into the body to see inside a body cavity or organ.

endotracheal intubations.definicao: A medical procedure in which a tube is placed into the windpipe (trachea) through the mouth or nose.

endovascular.definicao: Using wires, catheters, balloons, stents and devices to treat arterial disease in a minimally invasive way.

epidemiology.definicao: The study of patterns of health and disease in populations.

epidural.definicao: This is the injection of local anaesthetic or other pain-relieving medicines into a space that surrounds your spinal cord. It temporarily numbs your nerves. A procedure were a form of pain relief is injected into the space around the spinal cord to stop pain without sending the patient to sleep.

ercp.definicao: Endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography (ERCP) is technique where a thin flexible tube with a light and camera is inserted via the mouth.It is mainly used to diagnose and treat bile duct and pancreatic duct conditions.

fissure sealant.definicao: Fissure sealants are plastic coatings that are painted on to the grooves of the back teeth.

flexible sigmoidoscopy.definicao: A endoscopic procedure that allows the examination of the lining of the rectum and the lower part of the colon. A long flexible tube is inserted, which has a camera and light at one end (known as an endoscope).

foundation training.definicao: Part of a doctor’s training and takes place after the completion of a medical degree at university. It comprises a series of rotations in different specialties within hospitals or in the community. The first year of training is known as FY1 and the second FY2. Foundation training precedes specialist training in medicine or surgery.

gcses at grades a-c.definicao: Results for GCSE subjects in England are graded U to 9, with grades 4-9 being equivalent to GCSE grades C and above.

genetics.definicao: The branch of science that deals with how you inherit physical and behavioural characteristics, including medical conditions. Genes are what make you like your parents. They decide what colour your hair is, how tall you are and even what you sound like. They're like computer data that's carried on DNA (deoxyribonucleic acid) and decoded by your body.

genomics.definicao: A discipline in genetics that looks at the function and structure of genomes (the complete set of DNA within a single cell of an organism).

goc.definicao: General Osteopathic Council - the regulatory body for osteopaths in the UK

grades a-c.definicao: Results for GCSE subjects in England are graded U to 9, with grades 4-9 being equivalent to GCSE grades C and above.

haemodialysis.definicao: A method of removing waste products from the blood using a dialyser or artificial kidney.

harvesting veins.definicao: Removal of healthy veins to be used elsewhere in the body

hcpc.definicao: The Health and Care Professions Council. A regulatory body that maintains a register of a number of healthcare professions.

heart murmurs.definicao: Abnormal sounds caused by turbulent blood flow within the heart.

holistic.definicao: Relating to the whole thing rather than just a part. In a health setting this means having a concern for the whole person, where body and mind are linked.

hsst.definicao: NHS Higher Specialist Scientific Training. Training for registered clinical scientists to enable them to practise at consultant healthcare scientist level.

human genome project.definicao: A project to gain a better understanding of how certain traits and characteristics are passed on from parents to children.

hypertension.definicao: The medical term for high blood pressure. Hypertension is a major risk factor for stroke, especially hemorrhagic and lacunar strokes, because it puts excess stress on the walls of blood vessels and damages their delicate inner lining.

hysteroscopy.definicao: A procedure used to examine the inside of the uterus (womb).

in vitro.definicao: Techniques conducted in a laboratory setting, where a glass dish or test tube is used for observations made outside the body. A well-known example is in vitro-fertilisation, where sperm and egg are fertilised outside the body.

informatics.definicao: The science of computer information systems. As an academic field it involves the practice of information processing, and the engineering of information systems.

intensive care.definicao: The care of seriously ill people. The intensive care unit is sometimes called ICU. It's a special hospital ward where children are given lots of help. Doctors and nurses who have had extra-special training treat them.

intrauterine contraceptives.definicao: A small T-shaped device made from plastic and copper that is fitted in the uterus to prevent pregnancy. Also called a coil.

intubate.definicao: The insertion of a tube into a part of the body, often a breathing tube into the trachea (breathing passages). This enables mechanical ventilation, for example during surgery or as an emergency procedure.

linac.definicao: Linear accelerator, which is a device used for external beam radiation treatments for patients with cancer.

lipid disorders.definicao: Metabolic disorders that result in abnormal amounts of fatty substances that are insoluble in water (lipids) which may lead to serious illnesses.

local area networks.definicao: A computer network that connects computers within a limited areas such as a home, hospital or office buidling using network media. Abbreviated to LAN.

lumbar puncture.definicao: A procedure in which a hollow needle is inserted into the lower part of the spinal canal to withdraw fluid for testing. Also called a spinal tap.

magnetic resonance imaging (mri).definicao: An imaging technique that uses powerful magnetic fields and radio waves to provide detailed cross-sectional or three-dimensional images of the body.

metabolic.definicao: The processes, both physical and chemical, by which the living body is built up and maintained, and by which molecules are broken down to make energy available to the organism.

mhra.definicao: Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency

mitral valves.definicao: Valve with two tapered cusps, located between the left atrium and the left ventricle of the heart. Also called the bicuspid valve.

mrcp.definicao: Membership of the Royal College of Physicians

mri.definicao: Magnetic resonance imaging. Abbreviation for magnetic resonance imaging--a scan that creates detailed pictures of internal organs. MRIs use radio waves, a strong magnetic field, and a computer to produce images of organs and internal tissues.

multidisciplinary team meeting (mdt).definicao: Different professionals meet together to discuss the diagnosis and treatment of patients.  They include doctors from different specialties, nurses and many other professionals such as physiotherapists and occupational therapists.

nanotechnology.definicao: Enables scientists to examine molecules and atoms at the smallest possible microscopic level. Measurements are made in nanometers. One nanometer is a billionth of a meter.

nebuliser.definicao: A device used to administer drugs including corticosteroids for conditions such as asthma.

neonatal.definicao: Relating to an infant younger than 4 weeks of age.

nhs constitution.definicao: Sets out the rights that patients, the public and staff are entitled to, and the pledges that the NHS is committed to achieving.

nice.definicao: The National Institute for Health and Care Excellence (NICE) provides national guidance and advice to improve health and social care.

nmc.definicao: The Nursing and Midwifery Council. A regulatory body that maintains a register of nurses, midwives and health visitors.

objective structured clinical examinatio.definicao: A type of examination used in medicine and other health professions to test a broad range of clinical skills and other skills such as communication. The examination takes place via a series of stations usually lasting 5-10 minutes, and the student progresses from station to station with a different examiner each time. Actors may be used in place of real patients.

oedema.definicao: A build up of fluid in the body, causing the affected tissue to become swollen. The medical word for swelling. If you have an oedematous foot, you have a swollen foot!

on call.definicao: Where a member of staff is available to be called for work, usually outside normal working hours. This can involve answering enquiries over the phone, or physically attending the workplace. It can also sometimes involve sleeping at the workplace to be available to deal with emergencies.

oncology.definicao: The branch of medicine that deals with the study and treatment of tumours, particularly cancerous tumours. The study of cancer, how it develops and how it can be treated. The doctor who specialises in oncology is called an oncologist.

orthoses.definicao: Devices worn in shoes either to change the way the foot works while walking or to provide support. They are used to help pain outside the foot such as in the ankle, knee, hip or back.

paracentesis.definicao: Puncture of the wall of a body cavity by a hollow needle in order to draw off excess fluid or to obtain diagnostic material (eg abdomen or chest).

parenteral.definicao: The administration of drugs or other fluids into the body by any route except via the gastrointestinal tract (for example by intravenous or intramuscular injection or infusion).

parenteral nutrition.definicao: The provision of carbohydrate, fat and proteins via intravenous administration (feeding).

pathophysiology.definicao: The study of changes in the way the body works that result from disease.

perioperative.definicao: The goal of perioperative care is to provide better conditions for patients before, during and after the operation. The time before and after an operation.

personal development plan.definicao: An action plan based on self awareness, values, reflection, goal-setting and planning for career development. Abbreviated to PDP.

physiology.definicao: The science of the functions of living organisms.

pleural aspiration.definicao: A small needle is inserted into the space between the lungs and the chest wall to remove fluid that has accumulated around the lung.

plexus blocks.definicao: Regional anesthesia techniques that are sometimes employed as an alternative to general anesthesia for surgery of the shoulder, arm, forearm, wrist and hand.

polypharmacy.definicao: The administration of different drugs taken together, which increases the likelihood of side effects from drug interactions.

primary care.definicao: Care provided by GP practices, dental practices, community pharmacies and high street optometrists. It is many people's first (primary) point of contact with the NHS. Around 90% of patient interaction is with primary care services.

prostheses.definicao: Plural of prosthesis. An artificial device that replaces a missing body part, which may have been lost through trauma, disease, or congenital conditions.

ptp.definicao: NHS Practitioner Training Programme. An undergraduate route into healthcare science, via an accredited BSc (Hons) in healthcare science.

pulmonary embolism.definicao: Blockage of one or more arteries in the lungs by a blood clot that formed elsewhere, often in the legs. Typically accompanied by sudden shortness of breath, chest pain, and cough.

quality and outcomes framework.definicao: The annual reward and incentive programme that measures the achievements of GP practices. Abbreviated to QOF.

quality assurance.definicao: A way of preventing mistakes or defects in products and avoiding problems in customer service.

radiotherapy.definicao: Treatment of cancer patients with x-rays or other radiation. Using radioactive materials to treat diseases.

red flag.definicao: Symptoms that indicate a potentially serious disease and warrant prompt investigation and treatment.

respiratory.definicao: Related to the respiratory (breathing) system, which includes the nose, throat (pharynx), larynx, windpipe (trachea), lungs and diaphragm.

run through.definicao: Some medical trainee pathway posts are such that, once the trainee starts a pathway, provided they meet the Annual Review of Competence Programme (ARCP), they will continue on that pathway until they reach the end of their training.

secondary care.definicao: Relates to services provided by specialist doctors or other health professionals who generally don't have the first contact with the patient, but are referred by primary care (often by a GP). Secondary care services are usually provided in a hospital or clinic.

sepsis.definicao: The destruction or infection of tissues by disease-causing organisms, usually accompanied by a fever.

sickle cell disease.definicao: A serious inherited blood disorder where the red blood cells develop abnormally.

spinal block.definicao: This is a alternative to general anaesthesia when the surgical site is located on the lower extremities, perineum (eg, surgery on the genitalia or anus), or lower abdominal area.

stp.definicao: NHS Scientist Training Programme. A graduate entry route to become a clinical scientist.

stroke.definicao: Blockage or rupture of a blood vessel supplying the brain; often leads to impaired brain function or death.

subdermal contraceptive implants.definicao: A type of birth control. It is a small flexible tube measuring about 40mm in length which is inserted under the skin.

suture.definicao: The process of sewing tissues together after surgery; or the stitch itself.

t levels.definicao:
T Levels are new 2-year courses, which will follow GCSEs and will be equivalent to 3 A Levels. They will offer students a mixture of classroom learning and 'on-the-job' experience during an industry placement of at least 45 days.

    Similar Terms:           t levels          T-levels          T-Levels          T Levels

t&o.definicao: Trauma and orthopaedic covers injuries and conditions relating to bones, joints, ligaments, tendons, muscles and nerves

tertiary care.definicao: Treatment given in a large regional hospital that provides highly specialised care, for example in cardiac surgery or oncology.

thrombosis.definicao: Formation of a blood clot (called a thrombus) in a blood vessel or chamber of the heart.

tinnitus.definicao: A ringing in the ears or some other sound that has no external cause.

topical fluride.definicao: Professionally applied topical fluorides include higher-strength rinses, gels, and foams and fluoride varnishes;.

topologies.definicao: Plural of topology, an area of mathematics concerned with the properties of space.

tracheostomies.definicao: Plural of tracheostomy, an opening created at the front of the neck so a tube can be inserted into the windpipe (trachea) to help you breathe.

transient ischaemic attack (tia).definicao: Also known as a “mini-stroke”, this occurs when there is a brief interruption of the blood supply to the brain, causing symptoms similar to those of a stroke. The symptoms typically last less than one hour and are completely resolved within 24 hours.

united kingdom public health register.definicao: A register providing public assurance for the provision of a competent workforce that contributes to a high quality public health service. Abbreviated to UKPHR.

Traduções.pt: registro de saúde pública do reino unido *
Traduções.es: registro de salud pública del reino unido *

urticaria.definicao: An itchy rash of usually short duration. Also known as hives.

wide area networks.definicao: A network covering a broad area, ie any telecommunications network that links regional, national or international boundaries using leased telecommunications.

working time directive.definicao: Gives EU workers the right to a minimum number of holidays each year, rest breaks, and rest of at least 11 hours in any 24 hours; restricts excessive night work; gives a day off after a week's work; and provides for a right to work no more than 48 hours per week.

5-alpha reductase.definicao: A chemical that changes the sex hormone testosterone into a substance called dihydrotestosterone. This hormone can cause the prostate gland to grow abnormally.

abdominal muscles.definicao: A flat sheet of muscles on the front of the abdomen, between the ribcage and the pelvis.

abdominoplasty.definicao: A procedure to remove excess abdominal skin and tighten the underlying stomach muscles. Also known as a tummy tuck.

abduction.definicao: Movement of a body part, such as an arm or leg, away from the center of the body.

ablation.definicao: A form of treatment that uses electrical energy, heat, cold, alcohol, or other modalities to destroy a small section of damaged tissue.

abrasion.definicao: A scraping or rubbing away of the skin or other surface.

abscess.definicao: A collection of pus, which usually happens as a result of an infection. Pus is made up of old white blood cells and broken down tissue cells. Abscesses can be very painful and may need to be drained.

abutment.definicao: A tooth or implant to which a fixed prosthesis is anchored.

acceptance-based therapies.definicao: Psychotherapy techniques that use mindfulness to help a person recognize and accept thoughts and feelings but not be controlled by them.

accommodation.definicao: The eye's ability to focus on objects that are close.

ace.definicao: Abbreviation for angiotensin-converting enzyme, an enzyme that converts the inactive form of the protein angiotensin (angiotensin I) to its active form—angiotensin II.

ace inhibitor.definicao: Abbreviation of angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitor, a drug used to treat high blood pressure and congestive heart failure.

acetabulum.definicao: A curved, bowl-shaped depression in the outer part of the hipbone. The ball-shaped portion at the top of the thighbone fits into this space to form the hip joint.

acetaldehyde.definicao: The main breakdown product of alcohol metabolism; accumulation of it in the bloodstream may produce flushing (a feeling of heat in the face or chest) and vomiting.

acetaminophen.definicao: A common, over-the-counter drug used to reduce fever and relieve mild to moderate pain, but which does not reduce redness or swelling (inflammation).

acetylcholine.definicao: A neurotransmitter (a chemical messenger that sends signals between brain cells) that plays roles in attention, learning, and memory.

achilles’ tendon.definicao: A band of connective tissue that connects the calf muscle to the heel bone. This tissue is prone to swelling and/or rupture.

achlorhydria.definicao: A condition in which the stomach produces little or no acid. This can affect digestion, cause stomach pain, and keep the body from absorbing vitamins and nutrients.

acne.definicao: An inflammatory disease resulting from excess sebum production, follicle plugging, and increased bacterial production.

acquired immunodeficiency syndrome.definicao: Usually abbreviated as AIDS. This is the most advanced stage of infection with the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV), which can severely weaken the immune system. People with AIDS get many infections, often from diseases that don’t affect people with healthy immune systems.

acquisition.definicao: The term given to the brain's absorption of new information to begin creating a memory.

acromioclavicular joint.definicao: A shoulder joint that connects the clavicle to the scapula.

actin.definicao: One of the proteins that allows cells to move and muscles to contract.

actinic keratosis.definicao: Scaly pink or red-brown raised spots or patches on the skin caused by overexposure to the sun. Actinic keratosis may be a precursor to skin cancer.

active surveillance.definicao: A strategy for managing early prostate cancer in which a man has regular checkups but does not undergo treatment until the disease shows signs of worsening.

acupressure.definicao: Using the thumb or fingers to apply pressure to particular spots, or pressure points, on the body in order to relieve pain.

acupuncture.definicao: A treatment based on Chinese medicine. Thin needles are inserted into the skin at specific points on the body. This therapy is used to treat pain and various health problems and to reduce stress.

acute.definicao: If it's acute, it's strong or intense or comes on suddenly.

acute pain.definicao: Severe pain that occurs suddenly and usually lasts a short while.

acute urinary retention.definicao: A sudden inability to empty the bladder. Causes include an enlarged prostate gland (in men) or bladder muscle problems.

adaptability.definicao: The ability of an organism to change genetically in a way that allows it to deal better with its environmental conditions.

adaptive immunity.definicao: The ability of the body to learn to fight specific infections after being exposed to the germs that cause them.

addiction.definicao: Loss of control over indulging in a substance or performing an action or behavior, and continued craving for it despite negative consequences.

adduction.definicao: Movement of a body part toward or across the midline.

adenocarcinoma.definicao: A type of cancer that grows in the layer of tissue known as the epithelium. This tissue lines organs and structures in the body, protecting or enclosing them.

adenoma.definicao: A benign growth found in the layer of cells that lines certain organs (epithelial cells).

adenosine triphosphate.definicao: An energy-storing molecule that is found in all human cells. Usually abbreviated as ATP.

adequate intake.definicao: An estimate of the amount of a nutrient needed by healthy people. The Adequate Intake is used when there isn’t enough information to set a recommended dietary allowance (RDA).

adjuvant therapy.definicao: Extra therapy given after a primary treatment, to increase the effectiveness of the primary treatment. For example, using chemotherapy after surgery or radiation treatment for cancer.

adrenal glands.definicao: These are part of the endocrine system and secrete hormones (chemical messengers that turn on and off processes in the body). Your adrenal glands are on top of each kidney.

adrenaline.definicao: Stress hormone that puts the body on high alert. Changes include faster heartbeat, more rapid breathing, greater energy, and higher blood pressure. Also called epinephrine.

adult day services.definicao: Centers providing daytime services to adults who need supervision, social support, or assistance with daily activities.

adulterant.definicao: An ingredient in a medicinal product (herb, supplement, or prescription drug), which dilutes the purity of the product and does not contribute to its therapeutic effects.

advance care directive (or advance medic.definicao: A legal document that describes the kind of medical care a person want if an accident or illness leaves him or her unable to make or communicate decisions.

Traduções.pt: diretiva antecipada de cuidados (ou diretiva médica antecipada) *
Traduções.es: directiva anticipada de atención (o directiva médica anticipada) *
Traduções.en: advance care directive (or advance medical directive)

advanced sleep phase syndrome.definicao: A pattern of falling asleep and waking up earlier than wanted that worsens progressively over time.

Traduções.pt: síndrome da fase avançada do sono *
Traduções.es: síndrome de fase avanzada del sueño *

aerobic.definicao: Any process that requires oxygen. Often used to describe a form of exercise, aerobic exercise.

aerobic exercise.definicao: Physical activity that speeds breathing, improves heart and lung function, and offers many other health benefits. Examples include brisk walking, running, or cycling.

aesthetician.definicao: Licensed skin care professional who performs procedures such as deep cleansing, low-grade chemical peels, microdermabrasion, and postsurgical skin care.

after-cataract.definicao: Clouding of the lens of the eye that can occur months or years after cataract surgery.

age-related cognitive decline.definicao: The slight loss of memory and slowing of the brain’s information processing that occurs with normal aging.

Traduções.es: deterioro cognitivo relacionado con la edad *

age-related macular degeneration.definicao: A potentially blinding condition that destroys sharp central vision.

Traduções.es: la degeneración macular relacionada con la edad *

agnosia.definicao: A rare disease in which a person can’t recognize objects, shapes, or people. Often due to a brain or neurological condition.

agonist.definicao: 1) A substance that triggers a physiological response when it combines with a receptor. 2) A muscle whose contraction is opposed by another muscle.

agoraphobia.definicao: Fear and avoidance of public places and open spaces.

aids.definicao: abbreviation for acquired immunodeficiency syndrome, the most advanced stage of infection with the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV).

aids dementia.definicao: A loss of brain function that occurs rapidly in some AIDS patients; marked by forgetfulness, difficulty thinking, and trouble focusing.

albinism.definicao: A group of inherited conditions that typically appear as a reduction or absence of melanin pigments in the skin, hair, and eyes.

albumin.definicao: A protein made by the liver. Abnormal levels of this substance may indicate liver or kidney disease.

albuminuria.definicao: High amounts of albumin (a protein made by the liver) in the urine, possibly indicating kidney dysfunction.

alcohol abuse.definicao: Continuing consumption of alcohol despite alcohol-related social or interpersonal problems.

alcohol dehydrogenase.definicao: A liver enzyme that metabolizes alcohol into a substance called acetaldehyde, which is toxic. Sometimes referred to as ADH.

alcohol dependence.definicao: A chronic, progressive disease characterized by excessive and often compulsive drinking, impaired control over drinking, use of alcohol despite adverse consequences, and withdrawal symptoms when alcohol use is discontinued. Also known as alcoholism.

alcoholism.definicao: Another term for alcohol dependenceA chronic, progressive disease characterized by excessive and often compulsive drinking, impaired control over drinking, use of alcohol despite adverse consequences, and withdrawal symptoms when alcohol use is discontinued. Also known as alcoholism.

aldosterone.definicao: A hormone secreted by the adrenal glands that helps regulate blood pressure by controlling sodium and potassium levels in the body.

alendronate.definicao: A drug used to treat and prevent osteoporosis by slowing bone loss.

alimentary canal.definicao: Another term for the gastrointestinal, or digestive, tract.

allele.definicao: One of two or more versions of a gene. Different alleles produce variations in inherited characteristics, such as eye color.

allergen.definicao: Something that cause an allergic reaction.

allergic.definicao: Having a sensitivity to one or more normally harmless substances.

allergic rhinitis.definicao: A seasonal or year-round allergic condition marked by sneezing, runny nose, and congestion. The most common type of allergy, it is caused by an IgE-mediated immune response to inhaled airborne allergens.

allergy.definicao: Lots of people have allergies. They're something that your body reacts to, and often include foods and materials that you come into contact with. Usually they are harmless, but for some people they can be much more serious and make them very ill.

allodynia.definicao: Pain resulting from something not normally painful, such as a light touch.

alopecia areata.definicao: An autoimmune condition that appears as patchy hair loss on the scalp that may result in permanent hair loss.

alopecia totalis.definicao: Hair loss that involves the entire scalp.

alopecia universalis.definicao: Hair loss that involves the entire body.

alpha blockers.definicao: A group of drugs that lower blood pressure by blocking the effects of adrenaline or adrenaline-like substances on cells' alpha receptors. Also used to treat some prostate gland problems. Alpha blockers are also known as alpha-adrenergic antagonists, alpha-adrenergic blocking agents, and alpha-adrenergic blockers.

alpha cells.definicao: Cells in the pancreas that produce the hormone glucagon.

alpha hydroxy acids.definicao: Fruit-derived acids used in creams and lotions to act as exfoliants.

alpha waves.definicao: A type of brain wave generated when a person is relaxed, awake, and receiving no visual input (eyes closed or in the dark).

alpha-delta sleep.definicao: Abnormal deep sleep; also called non-restorative sleep.

alpha-glucosidase inhibitor.definicao: A drug used to treat Type 2 diabetes.

alveolar bone.definicao: The part of the jawbone that supports the teeth.

alveoli.definicao: Tiny air sacs in the lung. They are where oxygen enters and carbon dioxide leaves the bloodstream.

alzheimer's disease.definicao: A progressive brain disease that causes memory loss, impaired thinking, and personality changes.

ambulatory.definicao: Able to walk; not confined to a bed.
pt: Passeio, galeria, cor-redor, ambulatorial, refere–se a paciente  que pode caminhar/andar

amd.definicao: Abbreviation for age-related macular degeneration, a potentially blinding condition that destroys sharp central vision.

amputation.definicao: The surgical removal of a limb or other body part.

amsler grid.definicao: A tool used to check for vision problems, particularly macular degeneration. The grid looks like graph paper with a dot in the center.

amygdala.definicao: Part of the brain involved in memory and emotion.

amylase.definicao: An enzyme secreted by the pancreas that breaks starch into sugar.

amyloid.definicao: A protein that collects in tissues when certain diseases, including Alzheimer’s disease, are present.

anaerobic.definicao: Any process that doesn’t require oxygen. Often refers to a form of short, high intensity exercise, known as anaerobic exercise.

anaerobic exercise.definicao: Exercise that improves the efficiency of energy-producing systems that do not rely on oxygen. Examples include sprinting and weight lifting.

anagen.definicao: The active growth phase of the hair-growth cycle.

anal canal.definicao: The last inch of the large intestine, leading to the anal opening.

analgesic.definicao: A drug or other substance such as aspirin, acetaminophen, or morphine that is used to relieve pain.

analytic variability.definicao: Differences in how a test is done, for example how a sample is prepared, which can affect test outcomes.

anaphylaxis.definicao: Lots of people have allergies, which means they can't eat certain foods or touch some materials. Anaphylaxis is a severe type of allergic reaction.

androgen.definicao: Any of a group of male sex hormones, including testosterone, that controls male characteristics such as beard growth.

androgenetic alopecia.definicao: Female- and male-pattern baldness. The condition appears to involve a heightened response by the hair follicle to androgen levels in the body.

androgen-independent prostate cancer.definicao: Prostate cancer that no longer responds to hormone therapy.

Traduções.pt: câncer de próstata independente de andrógeno *
Traduções.es: cáncer de próstata independiente de andrógenos *

anemia.definicao: Having a lower than normal amount of red blood cells or hemoglobin (an oxygen-carrying protein inside red blood cells), leading to low energy, weakness, and other symptoms.

anencephaly.definicao: A birth defect in which an infant is born without most of the brain or without the skull bones covering the brain.

anesthesia.definicao: Temporarily blocking sensation, especially the feeling of pain.

aneurysm.definicao: A bulge or swelling on a portion of a blood vessel, due to weakness in the wall of that vessel.

angina pectoris.definicao: Temporary chest pain that occurs when the heart isn’t getting enough oxygen and blood, usually occurring in response to physical activity or stress.

angiogenesis.definicao: The formation of new blood vessels.

angiotensin.definicao: A protein that raises blood pressure by narrowing blood vessels and causing the kidneys to store more sodium and water.

angiotensin i.definicao: An inactive form of the protein angiotensin. It is the precursor to the active form, angiotensin II.

angiotensin ii.definicao: The active form of the protein angiotensin, which raises blood pressure by narrowing blood vessels and causing the kidneys to store more sodium and water.

angiotensin-converting enzyme.definicao: An enzyme that converts the inactive form of the protein angiotensin (angiotensin I) to its active form—angiotensin II. Usually abbreviated as ACE.

angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitor.definicao: A drug used to treat high blood pressure and congestive heart failure. These drugs stop the production of angiotensin II. This lowers blood pressure and reduces the heart's workload. Usually abbreviated as ACE inhibitor.

Traduções.pt: inibidor da enzima conversora de angiotensina *
Traduções.es: inhibidor de la enzima convertidora de angiotensina *

ankle-brachial index.definicao: A test that compares blood pressure at the ankle with blood pressure at the elbow. A difference between the two indicates the presence of peripheral artery disease.

ankylo-.definicao: Means crooked or bent; refers to stiffening of a joint.

ankylosing spondylitis.definicao: A disease that leads to swelling between the disks of the spine and in the joints where the pelvis and spine meet. Causes back pain and stiffness and can limit movement.

annulus.definicao: Term used to describe ring or circle shaped objects or body parts.

annulus fibrosus.definicao: The tough outer covering of the discs in the spine.

anorectal dysfunction.definicao: Abnormal functioning of the anus and rectum, causing constipation or the inability to control bowel movements.

anorexia.definicao: An eating disorder in which a person has an intense fear of gaining weight and severely limits calories to the point of near starvation.

antagonist.definicao: The muscle opposing the major muscle required to do a task. It works to help balance movement and ward off injury.

anterior myocardial infarction.definicao: A heart attack affecting the front of the heart.

antiandrogen.definicao: A drug that blocks or interferes with the activity of male sex hormones.

antibiotic.definicao: A substance that kills or slows the growth of bacteria.

antibody.definicao: A substance in your blood that reacts with a foreign invader such as a germ or something you’re allergic to (allergen). In some cases, you develop antibodies when you have an infection so you are less likely to have it again.

anticoagulant.definicao: A substance that helps prevent blood from clotting.

anticoagulants.definicao: Drugs that diminish the blood's ability to clot. Anticoagulants are sometimes called blood thinners even though they do not thin the blood. Commonly used anticoagulant drugs include heparin and warfarin.

anti-cyclic citrullinated peptide.definicao: An antibody used to help diagnose rheumatoid arthritis.

antidepressant.definicao: A psychiatric drug used to treat mood disorders, such as depression.

antiemetic.definicao: A drug that prevents nausea and vomiting.

antigen.definicao: Any substance that the body sees as harmful or foreign, causing the immune system to form antibodies in defense.

antigen-presenting cell.definicao: Specialized white blood cells that detect harmful substances in the body and then signal other immune system defenders (known as T-cells) to mount a defense.

antihistamine.definicao: Medications that treat allergies and reduce symptoms such as sneezing and itching by blocking histamine, the substance in the body which causes these symptoms.

antihypertensives.definicao: Medications used to lower and control high blood pressure.

antileukotriene.definicao: A type of asthma medication that reduces swelling in airways and prevents muscles near the airways from tightening.

antimicrobial.definicao: A general term for antibiotics and other drugs that fight microscopic organisms in the body, such as bacteria, viruses, fungi, and parasites.

antioxidant.definicao: Substances that protect the body from molecules that damage cells (free radicals); examples include beta carotene, vitamin C, vitamin A, and vitamin E.

antiplatelet agents.definicao: Medications or other substances that prevent blood cells called platelets from clustering and forming blood clots.

antipsychotic.definicao: A drug used to treat schizophrenia and other severe mental health disorders; relieves symptoms such as delusions and hallucinations.

antiseptic.definicao: Something that prevents infection. You can get antiseptic mouthwash, antiseptic cream, and antiseptic hand wipes, all of which prevent infection.

antispasmodic drugs.definicao: Drug that relieves cramps and muscle spasms.

antithyroid drugs.definicao: Drugs used to treat an overactive thyroid.

anus.definicao: The external opening at the end of digestive tract where feces are expelled.

aphasia.definicao: Difficulty speaking or comprehending language; a common occurrence after a stroke affecting the left hemisphere of the brain, where language is processed.

apnea.definicao: A temporary pause in breathing during sleep that can be very brief or can last so long that the amount of oxygen in the blood drops dangerously low.

apolipoproteins.definicao: Proteins that combine with cholesterol and triglyceride to form lipoproteins.

apoptosis.definicao: A process of programmed cell death in which redundant or flawed cells destroy themselves.

amyloid precursor protein.definicao: A normal brain protein that under certain circumstances produces beta amyloid, abnormal protein deposited in the brain in Alzheimer’s disease. Usually abbreviated as APP.

apraxia.definicao: A brain disorder in which a person cannot perform certain actions, such as combing hair, picking up a pencil, or speaking, even though they want to and have the physical ability to do so.

aqueous humor.definicao: Clear fluid that fills the front part of the eye.

arbovirus.definicao: A virus transmitted by mosquitoes or other member of the arthropod phylum.

arousal.definicao: The state of being awake or reactive to stimuli through one or more of the five senses.

arrector pili.definicao: The small muscle associated with an individual hair follicle that enables hair to stand on end.

arrhythmia.definicao: This is when the heart doesn’t beat in a regular way – some people have this all the time, and they need something called a pacemaker to make the heart beat regularly.

arterial resistance.definicao: The pressure that the artery walls exert on blood flow; in general, the less elastic the arteries, the greater the arterial resistance and the higher the blood pressure.

arteriography.definicao: A test that uses x-rays and a special dye to see inside arteries.

arteriosclerosis.definicao: A term encompassing a variety of conditions in which artery walls thicken and become less flexible. Sometimes called hardening of the arteries. Arteriosclerosis occurs when cholesterol-rich plaque forms on the inner lining of arteries (atherosclerosis), when artery walls become calcified, or when high blood pressure thickens the muscular wall of arteries.

arteriovenous malformation.definicao: Abnormal connections between veins and arteries, usually caused by a birth defect.

artery.definicao: A blood vessel that carries blood away from the heart and to various parts of the body.

arthritis.definicao: A disease where your joints swell and become stiff and painful. Some people think only old people get arthritis but it can affect young people too!

arthrocentesis.definicao: A procedure to drain fluid from a joint using a syringe.

arthrodesis.definicao: Joining together two bones to reduce pain and provide stability to a damaged, arthritic, or painful joint.

arthroplasty.definicao: Surgically rebuilding or replacing a joint, usually to relieve arthritis or fix an abnormality.

articular cartilage.definicao: Smooth white tissue that covers the ends of bones where they come together to form joints.

asphyxia.definicao: A life-threatening lack of oxygen due to drowning, choking, or an obstruction of the airways.

aspirin.definicao: A type of pain relief that usually comes in tablets. Aspirin can be dangerous for children under 16 years old, so you should only ever take it if your doctor prescribes it.

assisted living.definicao: Live-in facilities for adults who need help with certain things, but do not need round-the-clock care. They provide residents with supervision and certain services, such as meals, transportation, or help with dressing, grooming, and other daily activities.

association cortex.definicao: The part of the cerebral cortex involved in processing information, rather than movement or sensory experiences.

asthma.definicao: A condition where you feel breathless and wheeze a lot. It’s caused by the passages in your lungs becoming inflamed, but it can be treated using drugs which open up these passages (bronchodilators).

astigmatism.definicao: Blurry vision caused by an irregular curve in the cornea of the eye.

astringent.definicao: A substance that contracts skin tissues and shrinks pores.

asymptomatic.definicao: Showing no signs or symptoms of disease, whether or not disease is present.

asystole.definicao: The absence of electrical activity in the heart.

ataxia.definicao: Being unable to control movement; symptoms include shaking and an unsteady walk.

atheroma.definicao: An abnormal build-up of fatty plaque inside an artery.

atherosclerosis.definicao: The buildup of fatty deposits (plaque) in the walls of arteries, causing narrowing and reduced blood flow; the disease responsible for most heart attacks and many strokes.

atherosclerotic plaque.definicao: A mixture of fats, cholesterol, and other tissue that builds up on artery walls.

atherothrombotic stroke.definicao: A type of stroke that occurs when a large artery to the brain is completely blocked by the formation of a clot.

athlete’s foot.definicao: This is a nasty infection you can get between your toes that is caused by a fungus. It’s very contagious so make sure you don’t walk around in bare feet when you’ve got it, and don’t share your shoes with anyone either. It can be treated using creams from your chemist.

atlas.definicao: Another name for the topmost vertebra of the neck, which lies just beneath the skull. Also called C-1.

atopic.definicao: Having an inherited predisposition to allergies.

atopic dermatitis.definicao: A long-term skin condition, most common in babies and children, in which areas of the skin are dry, itchy, red, and may crack. Also known as eczema.

atopic rhinitis.definicao: A seasonal or year-round allergy marked by sneezing, runny nose, and congestion.

atopy.definicao: The inherited tendency to develop allergies.

atp.definicao: Abbreviation for adenosine triphosphate, an energy-storing molecule that is found in all human cells.

atria.definicao: The upper chambers of the heart. There are two of these—the right atrium and the left atrium.

atrial fibrillation.definicao: A disorder in which the two upper chambers of the heart beat fast and erratically. Because blood isn’t pumped out of these chambers fully, it may pool and form clots that could lead to a stroke.

atrioventricular node.definicao: Also known as the AV node. A major part of the electrical system in the heart that acts as a gateway between the atria and the ventricles. An electrical signal generated by the sinoatrial node (the heart's natural pacemaker) moves through the heart until it reaches the atrioventricular node, a cluster of cells at the bottom of the right atrium. The AV node delays the signal before it is passed to the ventricles. This lets the atria fully contract before the ventricles contract.

atrium.definicao: One of the chambers in the heart.

atrophy.definicao: Wasting away of an organ or tissue due to undernourishment, disease, or aging.

atypical lobular hyperplasia.definicao: An overgrowth of abnormally shaped cells in areas of the breast that produce milk (lobules). atypical lobular hyperplasia is not cancerous but may become cancer.

audiogram.definicao: A chart that shows a person’s ability to hear at different pitches or frequencies.

audiologist.definicao: A health professional who assesses hearing and fits hearing aids.

audiometry.definicao: A complete hearing test that involves listening to sounds of different frequencies and volume.

auditory nerve.definicao: A nerve in the inner ear that transmits information about sound to the brain.

aura.definicao: Sensations such as chills, flashes of light, or a blind spot that come just before the occurrence of medical problems such as migraines or seizures.

autoantibodies.definicao: Proteins created by the immune system that mistakenly target healthy cells, tissues, or organs.

autoimmune response.definicao: When the body’s immune system mistakenly views the body’s own tissues and organs as foreign invaders and attacks them.

autologous fat transplant.definicao: Removal of fat from one part of the body to use as filler in another part, for example, to fill wrinkles and lines in the face and lips.

autonomic nervous system.definicao: The part of the nervous system that controls involuntary actions, such as blood pressure or breathing. It also plays an important role in the fight or flight response to danger.

autonomic neuropathy.definicao: Damage to the nerves that control involuntary body functions, such as digestion, heart rate, and bladder and bowel function.

autopsy.definicao: Surgically opening and examining a body after death to see if any diseases are present and to determine the cause of death.

av node.definicao: Abbreviation for atrioventricular node, a major part of the electrical system in the heart that acts as a gateway between the atria and the ventricles. An electrical signal generated by the sinoatrial node (the heart's natural pacemaker) moves through the heart until it reaches the atrioventricular node, a cluster of cells at the bottom of the right atrium. The AV node delays the signal before it is passed to the ventricles. This lets the atria fully contract before the ventricles contract.

avulsion.definicao: The tearing away of one part of the body from another—for example, a tendon tearing away from a bone.

axis.definicao: The second vertebra of the neck (from the skull); also called the C-2 vertebra.

axon.definicao: The long, slender extension of a nerve cell that conducts electrical impulses away from the nerve's cell body and on to nearby nerves.

b cell.definicao: White blood cells that come from bone marrow, and produce antibodies to fight off disease.

bacteria.definicao: A type of germ or bug which can make you ill. They’re treated using antibiotics.

balance.definicao: Ability to maintain equilibrium while stationary or moving.

balloon angioplasty.definicao: A procedure to open clogged heart arteries. A surgeon inserts and inflates a tiny balloon. It widens the blocked artery then expands a small wire mesh tube to keep the artery open.

balloon dilation.definicao: A surgical procedure to open a narrowed vessel or tube, such as the urethra, esophagus, or artery. A small, deflated balloon is inserted into the area and inflated to widen it.

barium study.definicao: An imaging test that allows doctors to see the inside of the esophagus and upper stomach. It involves swallowing a barium solution, which coats the esophagus and makes it possible for x-rays to see the inside of the intestine.

barrett's esophagus.definicao: The abnormal growth of stomach or small intestine cells in the esophagus, resulting from damage caused by the reflux of stomach acid; occasionally may transform into cancer.

basal cell carcinoma.definicao: The most common skin cancer. Basal cell carcinoma doesn’t spread to internal organs.

basal ganglia.definicao: Clusters of nerve cells deep in the brain that play an important role in movement.

baseline ekg.definicao: An electrocardiogram (EKG) tracing taken in a healthy individual for later comparison to subsequent EKGs.
