basilar artery.definicao: The artery that supplies blood to the cerebellum, the brainstem, and the back of the brain.

benign.definicao: Something that is slow-growing or won’t spread anywhere else. You can get benign tumours, which won’t spread throughout the body, for instance.

benign orgasmic headache.definicao: A severe headache that occurs when orgasm is reached.

benign prostatic hyperplasia.definicao: A noncancerous enlargement of the prostate gland that obstructs the flow of urine. Often called BPH.

benzodiazepines.definicao: Anti-anxiety medications that work by helping to maintain levels of the neurotransmitter gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA) in the brain.

bereavement.definicao: The period of grief and mourning after a death.

beriberi.definicao: A nervous system or heart disorder caused by lack of the vitamin thiamine (B1).

bernstein test.definicao: A test to try to reproduce heartburn symptoms; used by doctors to diagnose GERD (gastroesophageal reflux disease).

beta blockers.definicao: Medications that block epinephrine (adrenaline) and norepinephrine from attaching to certain parts of nerve cells known as beta receptors. Used to treat high blood pressure, heart rhythm problems, migraines, panic attacks, and other conditions.

beta carotene.definicao: A richly colored compound (red, yellow, or orange) found in many plants, fruits, and vegetables that the body can convert into vitamin A.

beta cells.definicao: Cells that make and secrete insulin; located in the islets of Langerhans of the pancreas.

beta agonists.definicao: A medication that opens airways by relaxing the muscles around the airway; used to treat asthma or COPD (chronic obstructive pulmonary disease).

beta amyloid.definicao: An abnormal protein deposited in the brain in Alzheimer’s disease.

biguanides.definicao: Medications that stop the liver from making excess glucose (sugar) and improve sensitivity to insulin.

bile.definicao: A thick, yellow-green fluid produced by the liver that aids in digestion.

bile acids.definicao: Fatty substances made by the gallbladder that aid in digestion.

bilevel positive airway pressure.definicao: A machine that helps people get more air into their lungs when sleeping by increasing the pressure or force of air when breathing in; often used to treat sleep apnea.

Traduções.pt: pressão positiva de dois níveis nas vias aéreas *
Traduções.es: presión positiva de dos niveles en las vías respiratorias *

binge drinking.definicao: Heavy bouts of drinking interspersed with periods of abstinence; often refers to the consumption of five or more alcoholic beverages within one day.

binocular vision.definicao: The ability of both eyes to focus on an object and form a single visual image.

binswanger's dementia.definicao: A type of dementia caused when blood flow is interrupted to the white matter of the brain, which lies beneath the cerebral cortex.

bioavailability.definicao: How quickly and completely the body can absorb and use a nutrient.

biochanin a.definicao: A natural compound found in soybeans that may help prevent cancer from spreading. It is a type of flavonoid.

biochemical recurrence.definicao: Usually used regarding prostate cancer. It refers to a post-treatment increase in the level of prostate-specific antigen in the bloodstream, indicating that prostate cancer has recurred or spread following the original treatment. Also called biochemical failure.

biofeedback.definicao: An treatment that helps people learn to gain control over normally unconscious body functions, such as breathing and heart rates.

biological variability.definicao: Normal fluctuations over time in the levels of a substance being measured (such as cholesterol).

biomarker.definicao: A distinctive biological indicator of an event, process, or condition.

bisphosphonate.definicao: Medications, including alendronate and etidronate, used to prevent and treat osteoporosis by slowing the breakdown of bone.

blackout.definicao: An episode of temporary memory loss resulting from the ingestion of alcohol or other drugs.

bladder neck.definicao: Where the bladder and urethra meet.

blepharoplasty.definicao: Cosmetic surgery to improve the appearance of droopy eyelids by removing excess skin and fat.

blister.definicao: A small pocket of fluid that develops between the upper layers of skin; often caused by friction or burns.

blocking agent.definicao: Substance that prevents a biological activity or process.

blood alcohol concentration.definicao: A measure of the amount of alcohol in the blood.

blood clot.definicao: A coagulated mass that occurs when blood cells stick together and form a solid.

blood pressure.definicao: Blood pressure shows how hard your heart is working to move blood around your body. When the doctor puts an arm-band around one of your arms and starts pumping air into it, they're checking your blood pressure.

blood urea nitrogen test.definicao: A test that measures levels of urea in the blood to assess how well the kidneys are functioning.

Traduções.pt: teste de nitrogênio ureico no sangue *
Traduções.es: prueba de nitrógeno ureico en sangre *

blood vessels.definicao: Hollow tubes that transport blood throughout the body; includes arteries, veins, and capillaries.

bmd.definicao: Abbreviation for bone mineral density, the amount of mineralized bone tissue in a given area.

bmi.definicao: Abbreviation for body-mass index, a measure of body fat estimated from a person’s height and weight. A healthy BMI is defined as 18.5 to 24.9. BMI = weight (in kilograms) divided by height (in meters) squared. Using English units, multiply weight in pounds by 703, then divide the result by height in inches, and divide that result by height in inches.

body mass index.definicao: A measure of body fat estimated from a person’s height and weight. A healthy BMI is defined as 18.5 to 24.9. BMI = weight (in kilograms) divided by height (in meters) squared. Using English units, multiply weight in pounds by 703, then divide the result by height in inches, and divide that result by height in inches.

bolus.definicao: A soft mass of chewed food. Alternatively, a single large dose of a medication given intravenously.

bone mass.definicao: The total amount of bone tissue in the body.

bone mineral density.definicao: The amount of mineralized bone tissue in a given area.

bone scan.definicao: A test in which radioactive material is injected into a person's bloodstream to help produce images of bones; often used to detect cancer or bone diseases.

borborygmi.definicao: Stomach growling; the rumbling noises caused by gas moving through the intestine.

botox.definicao: Brand name for a drug made of botulinum toxin type A that is injected into muscles and weakens them to ease the appearance of wrinkles.

bouchard’s nodes.definicao: Hard, bony growths that form on the middle joints of fingers in people with osteoarthritis.

bph.definicao: Abbreviation for benign prostatic hyperplasia, a noncancerous enlargement of the prostate gland that obstructs the flow of urine.

brachial plexus.definicao: A network of nerves that are rooted at the cervical spine and provide sensation and movement to the shoulder and arm.

bradycardia.definicao: A slow heart rate, usually below 60 beats per minute.

brain imaging.definicao: Technologies that allow doctors to view the structure of the brain or see how different parts of the brain function; examples include computed tomography (CT), magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), functional MRI (fMRI), and positron emission tomography (PET).

brain stem.definicao: The part of the brain that connects the brain with the spinal cord and controls movement, sensation, and reflexes.

brain waves.definicao: Electrical impulses generated by the firing of nerve cells in the brain (neurons).

breast augmentation.definicao: Cosmetic surgery to increase the size of the breasts.

breath focus.definicao: A form of meditation aimed at bringing on a state of relaxation.

broca's area.definicao: The part of the brain (in the frontal lobe of the left hemisphere) responsible for language comprehension and speech.

bronchial tubes.definicao: The airways that connect the lungs to the trachea (windpipe) and allow air to pass into and out of the lungs.

bronchiole.definicao: A small airway in the respiratory system that connects to the alveoli (air sacs); a branch of the bronchial tubes.

bronchodilator.definicao: Medication that eases breathing by relaxing the muscles surrounding the bronchial tubes.

bruit.definicao: Unusual sound, heard through a stethoscope, that blood makes when it rushes past an obstruction, like a blockage in an artery.

bunion.definicao: A bump of bone or tissue that forms at the big toe joint, causing inflammation and considerable pain.

bunionette.definicao: A small, painful bony bump that forms on the outside of the foot, at the base of the small toe.

bursa.definicao: A protective, fluid-filled sac located in or near the joints that cushions the movement of bone against tendons, skin, and muscle.

bursitis.definicao: Pain and swelling of the bursa, the small fluid filled pads that act as cushions in or near the joints.

bypass.definicao: A procedure used to divert the flow of blood or other fluids. When referring to the heart, shorthand for coronary artery bypass surgery, used to divert blood flow around a blocked coronary artery.

cabg.definicao: Abbreviation for coronary artery bypass graft. Surgery to improve blood flow to the heart by diverting blood around a blocked artery.

calcification.definicao: The buildup of calcium deposits in soft tissue, causing it to harden. Often seen in breast tissue by mammography or in coronary arteries by x-ray or cardiac CT scans.

calcitonin.definicao: A hormone that can stimulate bone growth and is sometimes used to treat osteoporosis.

calcium.definicao: A substance that is very important for keeping your bone, hair and nails strong. It’s found in dairy products and some other foods too.

callus.definicao: Hardened, thick skin that forms after repeated friction; often found on hands and the bottom of feet.

calorie.definicao: The unit for measuring the amount of energy in food.

cancellous bone.definicao: One of two types of tissue that form bone; this type is commonly found at the center of long bones and makes up a large part of the hip and spine. Also known as trabecular bone.

cancer.definicao: A group of diseases that are caused by cells forming in an uncontrolled way. There are lots of different types of cancer – some are easier to treat than others and some affect children more than adults. Research has meant that cancer is much more treatable than it was thirty years ago.

capillaries.definicao: These are the smallest blood vessel – most of them are only big enough to allow a red blood cell through.

capsaicin.definicao: An chemical found in hot chili peppers that is used in some pain relief creams.

carbohydrate.definicao: The sugars and starches in food that provide the body with most of its fuel. Carbohydrates are one of three primary nutrients along with fats and proteins.

carbohydrate counting.definicao: Keeping track of the grams of carbohydrates eaten in order to control weight.

carbon monoxide.definicao: A gas, which can be dangerous if we breathe it in for too long. Car exhausts and faulty gas fires produce it and its chemical symbol is CO.

carcinogen.definicao: Any substance that can cause cancer.

carcinogenesis.definicao: The process by which a normal cell becomes cancerous.

carcinoma.definicao: A cancerous tumor that develops in the tissue that lines the organs of the body (the epithelium).

cardiac.definicao: This is just another word for the heart.

cardiac catheterization.definicao: A procedure to diagnose or treat heart problems; a long, thin, flexible tube is inserted into a blood vessel in the arm, neck, or upper thigh and maneuvered into the heart to evaluate various heart functions.

cardiac output.definicao: The amount of blood the heart is able to pump into circulation; specifically measured as the amount of blood the left side of the heart can pump in one minute.

cardiac resynchronization therapy.definicao: A pacemaker-based therapy for heart failure that improves the heart's pumping efficiency by coordinating (resynchronizing) the beat of the ventricles.

cardiac tamponade.definicao: When fluid or blood pools within the sac surrounding the heart, squeezing the heart and interfering with its ability to pump.

cardioplegia.definicao: Temporarily stopping the heart during heart surgery.

cardiopulmonary bypass.definicao: The use of a machine (heart/lung machine) to circulate and oxygenate the blood while surgery is performed on the heart.

cardiopulmonary bypass machine.definicao: A pump used to oxygenate and circulate blood through the body while the heart is stopped during open-heart surgery.

cardiopulmonary resuscitation.definicao: This is sometimes called CPR for short. It’s a way of starting breathing and circulation again if a person has stopped breathing or their heart has stopped.

cardiorespiratory endurance.definicao: A component of physical fitness that relates to the ability of the circulatory and respiratory systems to supply oxygen during sustained physical activity. Also known as cardiorespiratory fitness.

cardioversion.definicao: The use of an electrical shock to stop an abnormal heart rhythm (an arrhythmia) and restore a normal one (sinus rhythm). Cardioversion can be external, using pads applied to the chest, or internal, from a pacemaker-like device called an implantable cardioverter defibrillator (ICD).

carminative.definicao: An herb said to expel gas from the digestive system, easing stomach discomfort.

carotenoids.definicao: Compounds such as lycopene and beta carotene that give red, yellow, and orange color to certain plants.

carotid artery disease.definicao: Narrowing of the carotid artery by the buildup of plaque. Sometimes called carotid artery stenosis. It is a major risk factor for ischemic stroke.

carotid bruit.definicao: An abnormal sound heard with a stethoscope in the carotid artery; people who have carotid bruits have a greater risk of having a stroke.

carotid duplex doppler scanning.definicao: An ultrasound image of the carotid arteries.

carotid endarterectomy.definicao: Surgery to remove fatty plaque buildup from the carotid artery and restore blood flow to the brain.

carpal tunnel syndrome.definicao: A condition that occurs when the median nerve, which runs from the forearm through the hand, is compressed; symptoms include pain, tingling, and numbness, as well as hand weakness.

cartilage.definicao: A substance that holds our body together. You’ve got cartilage in your ear, which is what makes it bendy, and also inside your joints, which stops the ends of the bones rubbing together.

cartilaginous joint.definicao: A joint in which the bones are firmly connected by cartilage, so that only slight movement is possible.

case-control study.definicao: A research study that compares one group of people with a particular disease to a very similar group that does not have the same disease.

catagen.definicao: The transition phase of the hair-growth cycle.

cataplexy.definicao: Sudden paralysis of some or all muscles brought on by laughter, anger, fright, or strong emotions; a hallmark of narcolepsy.

cataract.definicao: An eye condition where the lens becomes cloudy. This stops you seeing very well. It can affect anyone but it’s more common in older people. It’s fixed by removing the lens and replacing it.

catastrophic reaction.definicao: A strong emotional reaction to a minor event.

cathartic.definicao: An agent with a strong laxative effect.

cation.definicao: A positively charged ion; cations in the body include sodium, potassium, and magnesium.

cauda equina.definicao: A bundles of nerve roots that look like a horse’s tail, located at the end of the spinal cord.

causalgia.definicao: Intense, long-lasting burning pain usually caused by damage to a peripheral nerve.

cavity.definicao: A hole in the tooth caused by advanced decay.

cbc.definicao: Abbreviation for complete blood count—tests run on a blood sample to provide information on red cells, white cells, and platelets.

ccu.definicao: Abbreviation for coronary care unit, a ward in a hospital that provides specialized care and extensive monitoring for patients with heart problems.

celiac disease.definicao: A disease characterized by damage to the small intestine caused by an oversensitivity to gluten, a protein found in wheat, rye, and barley. Celiac disease can interfere with the proper absorption of nutrients from food.

celiac plexus.definicao: A network of nerves in the upper abdomen; medication is sometimes injected here as part of a therapy to ease pain called a nerve block.

cell.definicao: These are the building blocks of your body. Every part is made up of billions of cells each of which do a different job.

cell senescence.definicao: The end stage in the life of a cell when the cell can no longer divide.

cell-mediated immunity.definicao: A type of immune response mounted against viruses, certain types of parasites, and perhaps cancer cells.

cementum.definicao: The layer of tooth material that covers the root.

central (brain) fatigue.definicao: A lack of concentration or alertness as well as a sense of lethargy and loss of motivation; involves the central nervous system.

central nervous system.definicao: This consists of your brain and spinal cord and is referred to as the CNS for short.

central sleep apnea.definicao: A disorder in which breathing repeatedly stops during sleep, because the brain doesn’t properly signal the muscles that control breathing.

cerebellum.definicao: Part of your brain that is responsible for movement and balance. It’s at the bottom of your brain, lying next to your spinal cord.

cerebral aneurysm.definicao: A weakening and ballooning of the wall of an artery in the brain.

cerebral angiography.definicao: An invasive imaging procedure used to make detailed x-ray pictures of the blood vessels in the brain; dye is injected into the carotid arteries to highlight the blood vessels on x-rays.

cerebral cortex.definicao: The part of the brain involved in all forms of conscious experience, including thought, language, and memory.

cerebral hemorrhage.definicao: Bleeding in the brain caused by the rupture of a blood vessel; another term for hemorrhagic stroke.

cerebral infarction.definicao: A type of stroke caused when a blood vessel that supplies blood to the brain is blocked by a blood clot.

cerebrovascular.definicao: Pertaining to the blood vessels in the brain.

cerebrovascular accident.definicao: The medical term for a stroke.

cerumen.definicao: A substance that helps keep dirt out of the ear and lubricates the skin in the ear. More commonly known as earwax.

cervical radiculopathy.definicao: A pinched nerve, causing sharp pain, tingling, and numbness in the areas served by the nerve.

cervical spondyloarthropathy.definicao: Inflammatory arthritis involving the neck portion of the spine.

cervicogenic headache.definicao: Headache related to neck problems. Also called cervical headache.

cfs.definicao: Abbreviation for chronic fatigue syndrome, a disorder of ongoing, severe tiredness that interferes with a person’s ability to function well, isn’t improved with rest, and isn’t caused by another illness.

challenge testing.definicao: A way of testing for food allergy, usually in double-blind experiments in which neither patient nor doctor knows which food is taken in pill form.

chemical peel.definicao: A chemical solution applied to the skin to cause it to blister and peel, revealing a new layer of skin; treatment is used to improve the appearance of the skin, reducing lines, wrinkles, age spots, and other problems.

chemonucleolysis.definicao: A treatment for low back pain that involves injecting the enzyme chymopapain into a herniated disk.

chemoprevention.definicao: Using drugs or chemicals to prevent cancer.

cheyne-stokes respiration.definicao: Abnormal breathing where cycles of deep, labored breathing where cycles of deep, labored breathing are followed by cycles of weak breathing that can result in a total, temporary lack of airflow.

chiropractor.definicao: Someone who treats disease by manipulation and adjustment of body structures, often the spine.

chlorophyllin.definicao: A chemical found in green, leafy vegetables thought to help prevent cancer.

chlorosis.definicao: Severe iron-deficiency characterized by a yellow-green tinge to the skin.

cholagogue.definicao: A substance that causes the gallbladder to squeeze, increasing the discharge of bile.

cholecystokinin.definicao: A hormone that signals the gallbladder to contract, releasing bile, and causes the pancreas to release enzymes used in digestion.

choleretic.definicao: An agent that promotes bile production.

cholesterol.definicao: A waxy, fat-like substance produced by the liver and found in all food from animal sources; an essential component of body cells and a precursor of bile acids and some hormones.

cholinergic neuron.definicao: A nerve cell that produces acetylcholine.

chondromalacia.definicao: A painful condition caused by irritation to or wearing away of the cartilage on the underside of the knee cap; known as runner’s knee.

choroid.definicao: A thin layer of blood vessels and connective tissue between the white of the eye (sclera) and the retina.

chromosome.definicao: Structures that are found in every cell, which carry genetic material that makes you like your parents. Chromosomes are arranged in pairs and each cell contains 22 pairs of chromosomes and two others called sex chromosomes. It’s the sex chromosomes that decide whether you’re male or female genetically. If you’re male, you have one X chromosome and one Y chromosome and if you’re female, you have two X chromosomes.

chronic.definicao: Something that develops slowly or is around for a long time. For instance, you can have chronic kidney disease, which develops slowly over a period of time.

chronic fatigue syndrome.definicao: A disorder of ongoing, severe tiredness that interferes with a person’s ability to function well, isn’t improved with rest, and isn’t caused by another illness.
sinonimos: chronic fatigue and immune dysfunction syndrome

chronic kidney disease.definicao: Any type of kidney disease that lasts longer than three months and impairs kidney function.

chronic pain.definicao: Pain that persists after an injury has healed or a disease is over.

chronic pain syndrome.definicao: Long-term, severe pain that doesn’t spring from an injury or illness, that interferes with daily life, and is often accompanied by other problems, such as depression, irritability, and anxiety.

chronic paroxysmal hemicrania.definicao: Severe, frequent, short-lasting migraine-like headache attacks.

chylomicron.definicao: A fat globule that ferries triglyceride from the intestine to the liver and fat tissue.

chyme.definicao: A nearly liquid mass of partly digested food and digestive juices; found in the stomach and intestine.

cicatricial alopecia.definicao: A group of inflammatory hair disorders that can cause irreversible damage to the follicle that results in permanent hair loss and scarring. Also known as scarring alopecia.

cilia.definicao: Small, hairlike structures on the surface of some cells.

ciliary body.definicao: Part of the eye that produces the aqueous humor (fluid that nourishes the eye) and contains the ciliary muscle, which controls focusing of the lens.

circadian rhythm.definicao: The body’s biological clock that regulates the sleep/wake cycle and other physiological processes.

circle of willis.definicao: A circle of arteries at the base of the brain, connecting major brain arteries and supplying blood to all parts of the brain.

cirrhosis.definicao: A chronic disease of the liver that progressively destroys the liver’s ability to aid in digestion and detoxification.

ck.definicao: Abbreviation for creatine kinase, an enzyme found in the heart, brain, and skeletal muscle. Levels of creatine kinase are tested to diagnose certain illnesses.

claudication.definicao: A muscle cramp, usually felt in the calf, caused by poor blood flow to the legs.

clinical trial.definicao: A study that tests a therapy in humans, rather than in laboratories or on animals.

clonal expansion.definicao: An explosive increase in the number of fighter cells released by the immune system to fight a threat in the body.

clot buster.definicao: Medications that dissolve blood clots and restore blood flow through a blocked artery.

cluster headache.definicao: A short-lived, extremely painful headache that occurs repeatedly over a period of a few weeks or months and then disappears for months or years.

coagulate.definicao: The process where a liquid, such as blood, comes together to form a soft, semi-solid mass, like a clot.

coarctation.definicao: A narrowed area in the aorta (the main artery that leaves the heart) present from birth.

cochlea.definicao: The bit of the inner ear that turns sounds into nerve messages which travel to the brain.

cochlear implant.definicao: A piece of equipment for helping someone who is severely deaf to hear sounds and understand speech although it will always sound a bit different.

coenzyme.definicao: A small organic molecule, often made from B vitamins, that helps enzymes function in the body.

cognitive behavioral therapy.definicao: A form of therapy that aimed at recognizing and changing negative thoughts and behaviors.

cognitive function.definicao: All of the brain mechanisms involved with thinking, reasoning, learning, and remembering.

cognitive impairment.definicao: Problems with memory, language, thinking, or other brain functions, varying from mild to serious difficulty.

cognitive reserve.definicao: The capacity of the brain to use alternative neural pathways or thinking strategies in response to neurological injury from conditions such as Alzheimer’s disease.

colic.definicao: Severe abdominal pain caused by spasms in the intestines or in a portion of the kidneys.

collagen.definicao: A fibrous protein that is the main component of connective tissue in the body.

collagenase.definicao: An enzyme that breaks down collagen.

collateral circulation.definicao: A system of minor arteries, known as collaterals, that can serve as an alternate blood supply to the heart when a major coronary artery is blocked.

colles fracture.definicao: A break at the end of the main bone of the forearm, the radius.

colorectal adenoma.definicao: A growth on the colon or rectal wall that may develop into cancer.

colostomy.definicao: Surgery that brings one end of the large intestine out through an opening in the abdomen for elimination of stool.

colostrum.definicao: An antibody-rich form of breast milk, produced at the end of pregnancy and for a short time after birth, which strengthens a newborn’s immune system.

coma.definicao: When a person is in a coma, they are deeply unconscious and don’t respond to anything going on around them. People can recover from being in a coma sometimes after months or years!

combined hormone therapy.definicao: Estrogen combined with progestogen, prescribed to augment a woman’s depleted hormones during menopause.

combined hyperlipidemia.definicao: A condition, usually inherited, in which LDL cholesterol and triglyceride levels are very high.

common migraine.definicao: A migraine headache without any visual symptoms, such as not a blind spot, beforehand. Also called a migraine without aura.

communicable disease.definicao: Any disease caused by bacteria, viruses, or other pathogens that is spread from person to person.

compact bone.definicao: Hard, tightly-packed tissue that forms the outer shell of bones. Also called cortical bone or lamellar bone.

complement system.definicao: Proteins that kill viruses, bacteria, and other microbes directly or flag them for destruction by white blood cells.

complete blood count.definicao: Often referred to as CBC. A broad panel of screening tests that examine different parts of the blood and can be used to diagnose anemia, infection, and many other diseases.

complicated grief.definicao: A prolonged, intense reaction to bereavement that affects one in 10 people who lose a loved one. Key signs are inability to accept the death; frequent nightmares and intrusive, upsetting memories; detachment from others; constant yearning for the deceased; and excessive loneliness. Sometimes called traumatic or chronic grief.

complicated migraine.definicao: A migraine where one or more of the symptoms, such as visual problems, linger for at least a day after the headache is gone.

compounding pharmacy.definicao: A pharmacy that mixes custom medications for patients and doctors.

compression fracture.definicao: The collapse of a bone, most often a bone in the spine (vertebra).

computed tomography.definicao: An imaging technique that uses a computer and x-rays passed through the body at different angles to create a detailed, nearly three-dimensional picture of the body.

conception.definicao: The start of pregnancy, when an egg is fertilized by a sperm.

conductive hearing loss.definicao: Hearing loss caused by a blockage in the middle ear that prevents sound waves from reaching the inner ear.

condyle.definicao: A rounded knob at the end of a bone.

cones.definicao: Cells in the retina that are sensitive to color and light.

congestion.definicao: An accumulation of mucus or of blood in an organ.

congestive heart failure.definicao: An older term for heart failure, a disorder caused by a decrease in the heart’s ability to pump blood. Congestive heart failure referred specifically to the type of heart failure associated with the accumulation of excess fluid in the lungs or extremities.

conjugate vaccine.definicao: A type of vaccine made by attaching an antigen (a substance that the body deems harmful) to a protein. It is often used to immunize babies and young children.

conjugated equine estrogens.definicao: Estrogen medications produced from the urine of pregnant horses.

conjunctiva.definicao: The clear, thin membrane that covers the inside of the eyelid and the white part of the eyeball.

conjunctivitis.definicao: This is when the membrane over the front of your eye becomes infected and swollen. It makes your eye go really red and sore. If you’ve got conjunctivitis in one eye, don’t rub it and then touch your other eye, as it will spread. You should also avoid sharing flannels and towels with other people while you’ve got conjunctivitis too. It’s treated with eye drops and ointments.

connective tissue.definicao: A group of tissues in the body that provide internal support and bind other tissues in the body, including bone, cartilage, tendons, and ligaments.

consolidation.definicao: The process by which the brain transforms newly acquired information into long-term memories.

contact dermatitis.definicao: A rash or skin irritation that results when skin contacts an allergen or irritating substance.

continuous combined hormone therapy.definicao: Estrogen and progestogen taken daily by women whose estrogen levels are low, usually due to menopause or a hysterectomy.

continuous positive airway pressure.definicao: A therapy for obstructive sleep apnea in which a machine delivers a continuous stream of air which prevents the collapse of the airway during sleep.

Traduções.pt: pressão positiva contínua nas vias aéreas *
Traduções.es: presión positiva continua en la vía aérea *

contractile proteins.definicao: Proteins that help shorten the length of muscle cells, enabling them to contract.

contracture.definicao: Shortening of a muscle, usually because of disease or lack of use, that limits joint movement.

contrast medium.definicao: A fluid injected into the bloodstream or swallowed so that organs will show up on x-rays.

control group.definicao: A group of people in a medical study who receive either no treatment or the standard treatment, which is compared against a group who receive the treatment being studied.

controllers.definicao: Asthma medications taken daily to prevent or control symptoms.

contusion.definicao: A bruise. An injury that causes swelling, pain, and discoloration but doesn’t break the skin.

convulsion.definicao: Rapid uncontrollable shaking of the body caused by muscles contracting and relaxing repeatedly.

corn.definicao: An area of hardened, thickened skin usually caused by friction.

cornea.definicao: The front part of your eye that is very tough and prevents you injuring your eye. It’s transparent and covers the coloured part of your eye (iris) and the pupil too.

coronary angiography.definicao: A test that shows how blood moves through the blood vessels supplying the heart to identify narrowed arteries. It uses x-rays and the injection of a fluid called a contrast agent that can be seen on the x-rays.

coronary artery.definicao: Blood vessel that carries oxygen-rich blood to the heart muscle.

coronary artery bypass surgery.definicao: Surgery to improve blood flow to the heart by diverting blood around a blocked coronary artery.

Traduções.es: cirugía de bypass de la arteria coronaria *

coronary artery disease.definicao: A condition in which one or more of the arteries feeding the heart become so narrow in spots that blood flow is impaired or stopped entirely, causing chest pain or a heart attack. Often called heart disease or coronary heart disease.

coronary endarterectomy.definicao: Surgery to remove fatty plaque that has built up on the walls of a coronary artery.

coronary heart disease.definicao: A commonly used term for coronary artery disease, a condition in which one or more of the arteries feeding the heart become so narrow in spots that blood flow is impaired or stopped entirely, causing chest pain or a heart attack.

coronary spasm.definicao: Temporary constriction of an artery that supplies blood to the heart, slowing or stopping blood flow.

coronary care unit.definicao: A ward in a hospital that provides specialized care and monitoring for patients with heart problems.

corpus callosum.definicao: The large bundle of nerve fibers linking the left and right sides of the brain.

corpus cavernosum.definicao: Sponge-like tissue in the penis that fills with blood during sexual arousal, causing an erection.

corpus luteum.definicao: The egg follicle remnant left behind after an egg has been released during ovulation. The corpus luteum secretes the hormone progesterone to stimulate the growth of the endometrium.

corpus spongiosum.definicao: A cylinder of soft tissue surrounding a man’s urethra and running the length of the penis.

corrugator muscle.definicao: One of the muscles that forms frown lines on the forehead.

cortex.definicao: The middle layer and main structure of the hair shaft, consisting mainly of compact bundles of the protein keratin.

cortical bone.definicao: Hard, tightly-packed tissue that forms the outer shell of bones. Also called compact bone.

corticosteroids.definicao: Steroid medications made to mimic hormones produced naturally by the adrenal glands. They are used to treat a wide range of health problems.

corticotropin-releasing factor.definicao: A hormone made in the brain that triggers the body’s fight-or-flight reaction to external threats.

cox-2 inhibitors.definicao: Abbreviation for cyclooxygenase-2 inhibitors, medications that reduce pain and swelling by targeting a particular enzyme known as cyclooxygenase-2 (COX-2).

cpap.definicao: Abbreviation for continuous positive airway pressure, a therapy for obstructive sleep apnea in which a machine delivers a continuous stream of air which prevents the collapse of the airway during sleep.

cpr.definicao: Abbreviation for cardiopulmonary resuscitation, a combination of chest compressions and mouth-to-mouth breathing that keep oxygenated blood circulating to the brain and tissues.

cranial arteritis.definicao: Inflammation and damage to blood vessels supplying blood to the head and neck. Also called giant cell arteritis.

craving.definicao: Intense, often irrepressible urge for something; often a symptom of dependence on drugs, alcohol or addiction.

c-reactive protein.definicao: A protein made by the liver. High amounts of C-reactive protein may indicate that arteries are clogged (atherosclerosis).

creatine kinase.definicao: An enzyme that leaks into the bloodstream in high amounts if a muscle is damaged. Can be used to detect heart attack or muscle damage from other diseases.

creatinine test.definicao: A blood or urine test that helps doctors determine if the kidneys are working properly.

crepitus.definicao: Grating, grinding, or popping sound or feeling made when a joint is moved.

creutzfeldt-jakob disease.definicao: A rare, untreatable, rapid form of dementia that is fatal.

crohn's disease.definicao: A chronic disease that causes swelling of the digestive tract, pain, and diarrhea.

crown.definicao: The part of the tooth that is visible above the gum line. Also a restoration that covers the crown of the tooth.

cryotherapy.definicao: Use of extreme cold to freeze and destroy diseased tissue.

crp.definicao: Abbreviation for C-reactive protein, a protein made by the liver. High amounts of C-reactive protein may indicate that arteries are clogged (atherosclerosis).

crystalline lens.definicao: Part of the eye that changes shape so that the eye can focus on objects at different distances.

ct.definicao: Computerized x-rays that provide detailed views of the body and brain. Also known as a computed tomography (CT) scan.

ct angiography.definicao: Use of a CT scan and an injectable dye to show arteries and blood vessels in detail.

cubital tunnel syndrome.definicao: The pinching of a nerve at the elbow, causing numbness in the pinkie and ring fingers and part of the hand.

cupping.definicao: An indentation in the optic disc that grows abnormally large with glaucoma.

curettage.definicao: Using a spoon-shaped instrument to remove diseased tissue or sample tissue.

cushing's syndrome.definicao: A disorder caused by high levels of the stress-hormone cortisol resulting in damage to the body, including abdominal obesity, rounded red face, and other symptoms.

cuticle.definicao: The outermost, single-cell layer of the hair shaft.

cyanosis.definicao: A condition in which skin turns blue due to a lack of oxygen in the blood, often because of heart failure or lung disease.

cyclic guanosine monophosphate.definicao: A chemical in the body that widens blood vessels in the penis. This increases blood flow to the penis, causing an erection.

cyclic hormone therapy.definicao: Use of estrogen and progestogen for 10–14 days of the month to relieve symptoms of menopause.

cyclooxygenase.definicao: An enzyme that helps blood cells known as platelets stick to each other, a key step in the formation of a blood clot.

cyst.definicao: This is a sac of tissue that is separate from the surrounding tissue (for example, skin). It can contain air, fluid or semi-solid substances.

cystoid macular edema.definicao: An eye condition in which the retina (the macula) becomes swollen with fluid.

cytokines.definicao: Proteins in the body that act as messengers between immune system cells.

cytotoxic alopecia.definicao: Drug-induced hair loss that occurs some weeks after the start of chemotherapy; hair grows back after cessation of treatment.

d2 receptor.definicao: A type of dopamine receptor (see neurotransmitter receptors) that seems to be particularly important in addiction.

daily value.definicao: A guide to the amount of nutrients in a given food; Daily values are given in percentages based on a 2,000-calorie-per-day diet.

dandruff.definicao: This is when the surface of your head starts flaking, which leave you with white bits in your hair. It’s not catching but it doesn’t look nice. You can get rid of dandruff with a shampoo.

de quervain’s tendonitis.definicao: Painful swelling of the tendons at the wrist that move the thumb.

debility.definicao: Weakness or a loss of physical strength.

decibel.definicao: A unit of measurement for the loudness of a sound. The highest decibels indicate the loudest sounds.

declarative memory.definicao: Memory for facts or events (episodic memory); also called explicit memory.

decoction.definicao: An herbal product or tea made by boiling a plant in water.

decongestant.definicao: Type of medication used to relieve nasal congestion.

deep sleep.definicao: Stage of sleep where the brain is less responsive to outside stimuli.

deep venous thrombosis.definicao: A dangerous condition in which blood clots form in veins deep in the body, usually the legs. They may break off and block blood flow in the lungs, seriously damaging organs or causing death.

defenses.definicao: Coping strategies a person adopts to make it easier to operate in the world.

defibrillation.definicao: The delivery of an electric shock to the heart to stop an abnormal rhythm and restore a normal heartbeat.

defibrillator.definicao: A device that delivers an electric shock to the heart to restore normal rhythm. Used to treat cardiac arrest and other dangerous heart rhythm problems.

degenerative disease?.definicao: Any disease in which the organs or tissues in the body are damaged progressively over time.

degenerative disk disease.definicao: Normal, and sometimes painful, deteriorations in the disks of the spine that occur with age.

degenerative joint disease.definicao: Arthritis that occurs when the cartilage in joints breaks down over time; also called osteoarthritis.

degenerative spondylolisthesis.definicao: Arthritis of the spine that worsens over time; often caused by aging.

delayed sleep phase syndrome.definicao: A pattern of falling asleep and waking up later than wanted that tends to worsen progressively over time.

Traduções.pt: síndrome da fase atrasada do sono *
Traduções.es: síndrome de fase retrasada del sueño *

delirium.definicao: Sudden, severe confusion that occurs because of a mental or physical illness.

delta waves.definicao: Slow brain activity that occurs when a person is in deep sleep.

delusion.definicao: A false or irrational belief held by a person despite evidence to the contrary.

dementia.definicao: A loss of brain function that worsens over time and affects memory, thinking, behavior, and language.

dementia pugilistica.definicao: Loss of brain function, common among former boxers, caused by repeated blows to the head.

demineralization.definicao: The process by which bacteria destroy tooth enamel.

demulcent.definicao: A substance that soothes irritated tissues and mucous membranes.

dendrites.definicao: The parts of a nerve cell that receive signals from other nerve cells.

dendritic cells.definicao: Spidery-looking immune system cells that help protect the body from harmful substances.

denial.definicao: A defense mechanism characterized by the inability to recognize or admit that addiction is the cause of problems, rather than a solution or mere byproduct. Denial can also refer to the refusal to accept an upsetting reality, such as a serious illness or death or the feelings that follow either.

dental implant.definicao: A metal post inserted into the alveolar bone to support an artificial tooth or other prosthesis.

dentin.definicao: The layer of hardened tooth tissue under the enamel and around the pulp.

deoxyribonucleic acid.definicao: The substance found in the nucleus of cells that contains the genetic instructions for that living organism.

dermal papilla.definicao: A structure situated at the base of the hair follicle that contains nerves and blood vessels that fuel the cellular processes of the developing hair shaft.

dermatomyositis.definicao: A rare disease in which the muscles become weak and stiff and a skin rash appears.

dermis.definicao: The middle layer of skin that contains most of the skin’s structures, like collagen, nerves, glands, and hair follicles.

desiccated thyroid.definicao: An extract made of dried animal thyroid glands.

detoxification.definicao: The process of removing harmful, or toxic, substances from a person’s body.

detrusor instability.definicao: The sudden, strong need to urinate due to spasms in bladder muscles. Also called urge incontinence.

detrusor muscle.definicao: The layer of muscle in the bladder wall that squeezes urine out of the bladder.

diabetes.definicao: This is the condition where the amount of glucose in the blood is too high.

diabetic ketoacidosis.definicao: A complication of diabetes in which substances called ketones build up in the blood to dangerously high levels.

diabetic retinopathy.definicao: A complication of diabetes that occurs when the small blood vessels in the retina are damaged. It can impair vision or even lead to blindness.

diaphragm.definicao: This is a sheet of muscle which separates your chest from your abdomen. It helps you breathe and also stops your intestines moving up and blocking your chest. When you have hiccups, it's really your diaphragm squeezing tight!

diastole.definicao: The relaxation phase of the normal heart cycle.

diastolic blood pressure.definicao: The bottom number of a blood pressure reading, such as 134/78. It represents the pressure in the arteries when the heart relaxes between beats.

diastolic heart failure.definicao: The inability of the heart to relax properly between beats (diastole), making it difficult for the ventricles to fill completely with blood from the atria. This can occur when the heart muscle bulks up due to overwork or other causes or when the heart muscle stiffens and loses it flexibility.

diathermy.definicao: Use of high-frequency electric currents to heat deep muscle and joint tissue as a form of physical therapy.

dietary fiber.definicao: The part of plant foods the body can’t digest or absorb. Also called roughage.

dietary reference intakes.definicao: The recommended amount of vitamins and minerals individuals should consume per day.

dietary supplements.definicao: Vitamins, minerals, herbs, and other substances taken in hopes of improving health.

digestive tract.definicao: The series of hollow organs, including the mouth, esophagus, stomach, small intestine, large intestine (colon), rectum, and anus, which break down and digest food and expel waste.

digital rectal examination.definicao: An exam in which a doctor inserts a lubricated, gloved finger into the rectum to check for abnormalities.

digitalis.definicao: A drug that increases the strength of heart muscle contractions.

dihydrotestosterone.definicao: A form of the hormone testosterone that spurs the prostate gland to enlarge (benign prostatic hyperplasia).

direct transmission.definicao: The immediate transfer of an infectious agent from a reservoir to a susceptible host by direct contact or droplet spread.

discoid lupus erythematosus.definicao: A rare form of lupus that causes a rash or scarring of skin.

disk.definicao: One of the small, shock-absorbing cushions found between the bones that make up the spinal column (vertebrae).

diskectomy.definicao: The surgical removal of part of a disk (a small, shock absorbing cushion located between the bones of the spinal column).

diskitis.definicao: Swelling of one or more of the pillow-like disks located between the bones of the spinal column.

dislocation.definicao: The movement of a bone from its normal position.

dithiolethione.definicao: A substance found in cruciferous vegetables, like cabbage, Brussels sprouts, and broccoli, which may play a role in cancer prevention.

diuretic.definicao: A diuretic is a medicine that reduces the amount of water in the body by making you wee.

diverticulitis.definicao: The bulging out of small pouches or sacs of tissue from the colon wall.

diverticulum.definicao: A small pouch or sac of tissue that bulges out of the colon wall. The plural form is diverticula.

d-limonene.definicao: A substance found in citrus fruits.

dnr.definicao: Commonly used abbreviation for do-not-resuscitate order, a legal document that tells health professionals not to revive a person if his or her heart or breathing stops.

dominant.definicao: When the genetic trait carried by one allele of a gene pair eclipses the trait carried by another; for example, when a gene carries alleles for two different eye colors, the dominant eye color gene determines the person’s eye color.do-not-resuscitate orderA legal document that tells health professionals not to revive a person if his or her heart or breathing stops. Commonly referred to as a DNR.

dopamine.definicao: A chemical messenger (neurotransmitter) that affects movement and thought processes.

doppler ultrasound.definicao: A test that uses sound waves to measure how fast blood is flowing through blood vessels.

dorsal.definicao: Near the back of the body or an organ.

dorsal kyphosis.definicao: A rounded or curved back caused by spinal fractures from osteoporosis. Commonly called dowager’s hump.

double blind.definicao: A medical study in which the researchers and participants don’t know which group is receiving the medication or treatment being studied and which is getting a placebo (fake, inactive version of the medication).

double-contrast barium enema.definicao: An x-ray test done to check for colon cancer or other bowel diseases.

Traduções.es: enema de bario de doble contraste *

dowager's hump.definicao: A rounded or curved back (resembling a hump) caused by spinal fractures from osteoporosis.

doxazosin.definicao: Medication used to treat high blood pressure or an enlarged prostate gland.

dressler's syndrome.definicao: Inflammation of the sac surrounding the heart (pericardium).

dri.definicao: Abbreviation for dietary reference intake, the recommended amount of vitamins and minerals individuals should consume per day.

drusen.definicao: Tiny yellow deposits in the retina of the eye.

dry eye.definicao: Stinging, burning, or irritation that occurs when the eye doesn’t produce enough moisture.

dry-powder inhaler.definicao: A small device that helps a person breathe in dry medication so it reaches the lungs.

dual energy x-ray absorptiometry.definicao: An x-ray test used to measure bone density and check for osteoporosis.

Traduções.pt: absortometria de raio-X de dupla energia *

dual-photon absorptiometry.definicao: A test to measure bone density, usually in the spine or the hip.

duct.definicao: A tube or vessel in the body which carries the secretion of a gland; Secretion examples are tears, breast milk, etc.

duodenitis.definicao: Inflammation of the duodenum, which is the upper part of the small intestine.

duplex doppler ultrasound scanning.definicao: A tool that uses sound waves to reveal blood flow problems.

dupuytren’s disease.definicao: A condition that deforms the hand, causing fingers to curl toward the palm.

dura mater.definicao: A thin protective membrane covering the brain and spinal cord.

durable power of attorney.definicao: A legal document in which an individual appoints another person to make medical, financial, or other decisions when the individual becomes unable to make those decisions.

dysarthria.definicao: A speech disability caused by an injury to the brain centers controlling the face, mouth, neck, or throat. People with dysarthria may be able to understand speech and form the right words in their mind but cannot articulate them.

dyspepsia.definicao: Pain or discomfort in the upper abdomen; upset stomach or indigestion.

dysphagia.definicao: The medical word for when you have trouble swallowing.

dysplasia.definicao: Abnormal changes in cells of a tissue. The cells aren’t cancerous, but they can sometimes progress to cancer.

dyspnea.definicao: Difficulty breathing or shortness of breath.

dystonia.definicao: A disorder in which muscles twitch, causing uncontrollable twisting movements.

ear canal.definicao: A tube leading from the eardrum to the outer ear.

eardrum.definicao: A thin membrane separating the ear canal and middle ear.

earwax.definicao: A substance that lubricates the inner ear and helps protect it from dirt, damage, and infections.

ebct.definicao: Abbreviation for electron-beam computed tomography, a high-speed imaging technology use to evaluate the heart and measure calcium deposits in arteries.

eccentric action.definicao: When muscles move joints by lengthening. Also known as cerumen.

ecg.definicao: An abbreviation for electrocardiogram, a test that measures the electrical activity of the heart and detects heart problems. This stands for electro-cardio-gram and is a test which shows the electrical impulses travelling through your heart to make it beat.

echocardiography.definicao: A diagnostic tool that uses high-frequency sound waves (ultrasound) to make images of the heart's size, structure and motion.

eclampsia.definicao: A serious condition related to high blood pressure that can threaten the life of a pregnant woman and her fetus.

ectopic pregnancy.definicao: Pregnancy in which a fertilized egg implants in an abnormal location outside the uterus, usually in the fallopian tubes. Ending the pregnancy is necessary.

ectropion.definicao: When an eyelid, usually the lower one, flips outward so that the inner surface is exposed.

eczema.definicao: A skin disease that makes your skin really itchy and sore. It’s not catching and can be treated using ointments that reduce inflammation and stop the skin drying out.

ed.definicao: Commonly used abbreviation for erectile dysfunction, the inability to get or maintain an erection sufficient for intercourse.

eeg.definicao: Abbreviation for electroencephalogram, a test that measures the electrical activity of the brain and detects problems. This is short for electro-encephalo-gram. This is a machine that draws a picture of your brain waves – showing the electricity that flows through your brain. You might need an EEG if you're having seizures.

effusion.definicao: An abnormal buildup of fluid in a joint or tissue.

eighth cranial nerve.definicao: A nerve responsible transmitting sound and information about balance to the brain. Also called the auditory nerve.

ejaculation.definicao: A sudden discharge of a fluid from a duct; often used to describe the expulsion of seminal fluid from the urethra of the penis during orgasm.

ejection fraction.definicao: The percent of blood pumped out of the left ventricle with each heartbeat. A normal ejection fraction is in the range of 55% to 70%.

ekg.definicao: An abbreviation for electrocardiogram, a test that measures the electrical activity of the heart and detects heart problems.

elastin.definicao: A flexible, stretchy protein found in skin and connective tissue.

electrocardiogram.definicao: A test that measures the electrical activity of the heart and detects heart problems.

electroencephalogram.definicao: A test that measures the electrical activity of the brain and detects problems.

electrolysis.definicao: A permanent hair removal technique that destroys follicles one at a time with a hair-thin needle inserted into the base of the follicle.

electrolyte.definicao: Minerals in the body that are electrically charged and play an important role in body processes, such as regulating fluid levels in the body. Examples include calcium and sodium.

electromyography.definicao: A test that checks the health of muscles and the nerves that control them.

electron-beam computed tomography.definicao: A high-speed imaging technology use to evaluate the heart and measure calcium deposits in arteries. Sometimes referred to as EBCT.

Traduções.pt: tomografia computadorizada por feixe de elétrons *
Traduções.es: tomografía computarizada por haz de electrones *

electrophysiologic testing.definicao: A procedure used to provoke known or suspected arrhythmias.

elimination diets.definicao: A way of diagnosing food allergies in which suspected foods are removed from the diet one at a time until the food causing a problem is found.

ellagic acid.definicao: A chemical found in certain plants, such as raspberries and strawberries, that might help protect against cancer.

embolic stroke.definicao: A type of stroke that occurs when a blood clot that has formed elsewhere in the body breaks off and travels through the bloodstream until it blocks an artery that normally supplies blood to the brain.

embolus.definicao: A blood clot or particle that forms in one part of the body then moves through the bloodstream and lodges in a blood vessel elsewhere, blocking blood flow.

emetic.definicao: Any drug or other substance used to cause vomiting.

emg.definicao: Abbreviation for electromyography—a test that checks the health of muscles and the nerves that control them. This stands for electromyography – a test for measuring electrical signals in your muscles. These signals are the messages from your brain telling the muscle to move.

emission.definicao: The discharge or release of a substance, usually a fluid.

emmenagogue.definicao: Herbs that stimulate menstrual blood flow.

enamel.definicao: The hard outside layer of tooth material.

encephalitis.definicao: A severe and sometimes deadly inflammation of the brain that can be caused by a number of different viruses.

encoding.definicao: A multistage process by which sensation, perception, or thought is transformed into neural representations that can be stored in memory.

endemic.definicao: Continually present among people in a geographic region.

endocarditis.definicao: An inflammation of the heart lining or valves, usually caused by bacterial infection.

endocardium.definicao: The inner layer of the wall of the heart.

endogenous opioids.definicao: Painkilling substances made by the body.

endorphins.definicao: Substances in the body that reduce pain and create a feeling of well-being.

endothelins.definicao: Proteins that cause blood vessels to narrow and blood pressure to rise.

endothelium-derived relaxing factor.definicao: Chemicals in the body that cause blood vessels to expand or relax, lowering blood pressure. Often referred to as EDRF.

end-stage renal disease.definicao: Complete, or nearly complete, kidney failure. Dialysis or a transplant is needed for survival.

enkephalin.definicao: A chemical produced in the brain that reduces pain.

enteric nervous system.definicao: Part of the nervous system that controls the gastrointestinal system.

enthesis.definicao: A place where a ligament, tendon, or muscle attaches to bone.

entropion.definicao: An eyelid, usually the lower lid, which folds inward so that the eyelashes rub against and irritate the surface of the eye.

enzyme.definicao: This is a substance that controls a chemical reaction within the body. There are lots of different enzymes and each does a different job. For instance, enzymes control how your food is broken down in your stomach.

eosinophils.definicao: White blood cells that play an important role in allergic reactions.

epicardium.definicao: The outer layer of the wall of the heart.

epicondylitis.definicao: Pain and swelling in the tendons in the elbow, usually because of overuse.

epidemic.definicao: The occurrence of more cases of disease than expected within a population in a geographic area over a set period of time.

epidemiological study.definicao: An investigation of the links between certain behaviors or risk factors and the occurrence of disease or good health in a population.

epidural space.definicao: The space between the spinal cord and the bones of the spinal column where painkillers are injected.

epinephrine.definicao: A chemical that narrows blood vessels, increases heart rate, and helps trigger the fight-or-flight response to danger. Also called adrenaline.

epipen.definicao: A device used to inject a dose of medication (epinephrine) when a severe allergic reaction occurs.

epithelial cells.definicao: Cells which line organs and structures in the body, protecting or enclosing them.

epithelium.definicao: A layer of cells which lines organs and structures in the body, protecting or enclosing them.

erectile dysfunction.definicao: The inability to get or maintain an erection sufficient for intercourse. Sometimes referred to as ED.

erector spinae.definicao: A group of muscles and tendons in the back.

ergonomics.definicao: Designing and arranging work objects so that the user is comfortable, efficient, and less likely to be injured.

ergots.definicao: Substances derived from or made from a fungus; often used to treat headache.

eructation.definicao: The act of bringing up air from the stomach through the mouth with a characteristic sound. Commonly known as belching.

erythema.definicao: Redness of the skin because of widening of capillaries just below the surface of the skin.

erythema nodosum.definicao: Painful, red lumps beneath the skin; associated with Crohn's disease.

erythrocyte sedimentation rate.definicao: A test involving red blood cells; used to check for different infections, inflammations, and cancers.

erythropoietin.definicao: A hormone that controls red blood cell production.

esophageal manometry.definicao: A test to measure the pressure inside the lower part of the esophagus.

esophagitis.definicao: Irritation and swelling of the esophagus.

esophagus.definicao: The tube that carries food and liquids from the mouth to the stomach.

essential fats.definicao: Two fatty acids, omega-3 and omega-6, that the body needs for good health but can’t make so they must come from foods and supplements.

essential hypertension.definicao: High blood pressure with no known cause; also called primary hypertension.

esterified estrogens.definicao: Artificially made hormones used to manage menopausal symptoms.

esthetician.definicao: A person who specializes in non-medical skin care and beauty treatments.

estradiol.definicao: The primary form of the sex hormone estrogen produced by women.

estrogen.definicao: The main sex hormone in women.

estrogen receptor.definicao: A site on the surface of some cells to which estrogen molecules attach.

estrogen-replacement therapy.definicao: Use of medications containing the sex hormone estrogen by women to replace naturally-occurring estrogen lost during menopause.

etidronate.definicao: A medication used to treat bone loss due to Paget's disease.

eustachian tube.definicao: A tube connecting the middle ear and the back of the nose that lets air into the middle ear.

euthyroid.definicao: Having a thyroid gland that works properly.

excitatory neurotransmitter.definicao: A chemical that forwards a message from one neuron to another.

excitotoxin.definicao: A brain chemical that damages neurons.

executive functions.definicao: The component of thinking that organizes, plans, decides, and inhibits inappropriate impulses.

exercise.definicao: A structured program of physical activity that helps an individual become physically fit.

exercise stress test.definicao: The use of a treadmill, stationary bicycle, or other exercise machine while hooked up to heart-monitoring equipment. The test is used to determine if the heart's blood supply is sufficient and if the rhythm remains normal when the heart is stressed.

exophthalmos.definicao: A protrusion or bulging of the eye that occurs with Graves’ eye disease. Tissues behind the eye swell, forcing the eyeball forward. Also called proptosis.

exostosis.definicao: Abnormal bony growths in the ear caused by swimming regularly in cold water. Sometimes called surfer's ear.

experience sampling.definicao: A research technique for learning about people’s activity patterns and psychological processes that involves paging them at random times to obtain brief reports.

expression hopping.definicao: A common phenomenon whereby people jump to a different expression of addiction. For example, people with heroin addiction might transition to alcohol addiction. Hopping is especially common during the recovery process.

expression of addiction.definicao: The specific way in which a person manifests addiction, for example, through the use of cocaine, or compulsive gambling.

extend.definicao: To straighten out a joint (for example, extending the arms overhead).

external otitis.definicao: An infection or irritation of the outer ear, ear canal, or both. Also called swimmer’s ear.

extracapsular cataract surgery.definicao: A surgical technique to remove a cataract from the eye.

extract.definicao: A product made from substances that are drawn out of a plant or herb.

extraocular muscles.definicao: Six paired muscles that direct the eyes’ circular, side-to-side, and up-and-down movements.

extrinsic factor.definicao: An outside factor that has an effect on a person’s environment or well-being.

facet joints.definicao: Paired joints that link a vertebra to its neighboring vertebrae. They allow the spine to move as a unit.

facet rhizotomy.definicao: Surgical destruction of certain nerves and nerve roots to relieve pain.

false negative.definicao: Test results that show that a disease or substance isn’t present, even though it is.

familial combined hyperlipidemia.definicao: An inherited disorder in which the liver overproduces very low-density lipoprotein, causing high levels of cholesterol or triglycerides, or both.

familial hypercholesterolemia.definicao: An inherited disorder in which the liver cannot properly remove low-density lipoprotein particles from the blood, causing a very high cholesterol level.

fasting lipid profile.definicao: A laboratory test to determine the relative levels of high-density lipoprotein, low-density lipoprotein, and total cholesterol in the blood. Also referred to as a lipoprotein analysis, full lipid profile, or cholesterol profile.

fasting plasma glucose test.definicao: A blood test that determines the amount of sugar (glucose) in the blood after an overnight fast of at least eight hours.

Traduções.pt: teste de glicemia plasmática em jejum *
Traduções.es: prueba de glucosa plasmática en ayunas *

fast-twitch fiber.definicao: One of two main types of skeletal muscle fibers. Fast-twitch fibers are recruited most heavily when bursts of power are needed, as in sprinting. See also slow-twitch fiber.

fat.definicao: One of the three major nutrients, along with carbohydrates and proteins.

fatigue.definicao: A lack of energy. A decrease over time in the ability to perform a physical or mental task.

fatty acids.definicao: Components of fats that can be used for energy by cells.

fatty streak.definicao: The first stage of atherosclerosis, a build-up of fatty materials in the wall of a blood vessel.

febrile.definicao: Feverish; having a high body temperature.

fecal impaction.definicao: A mass of dry, hard stool that gets lodged in the rectum.

fecal occult blood test.definicao: A test that checks for colorectal cancer by detecting blood in the stool.

Traduções.pt: exame de sangue oculto nas fezes *
Traduções.es: prueba de sangre oculta en heces *

fetal alcohol syndrome.definicao: A collection of birth defects resulting from exposure of the fetus to alcohol during pregnancy.

fiber.definicao: A substance found in plant foods that the body can’t digest.

fibrillation.definicao: Rapid and uncoordinated contractions of heart muscle fibers. When this occurs, the heart can't properly contract or pump blood.

fibrin.definicao: A stringy protein that is the primary component of a blood clot.

fibrinogen.definicao: A protein that helps stop bleeding by aiding in forming blood clots.

fibroadenoma.definicao: A tumor that is not cancer; usually found in the breast.

fibroblast.definicao: A cell that helps form the collagen and elastic fibers of connective tissue.

fibroid.definicao: A tumor that is not cancer, which is found in the uterus.

fibromyalgia.definicao: A condition causing pain and tender spots throughout the body.

fibrous plaque.definicao: A buildup of fat on the inside of a blood vessel that interferes with blood flow.

filtering procedure.definicao: A procedure to treat glaucoma in which a surgeon creates a drainage hole in the eye to relieve pressure.

finasteride.definicao: A medication for treating benign prostatic hyperplasia (enlargement of the prostate gland).

fixed joint.definicao: An area where two bones meet that is fixed, or doesn’t move.

flat feet.definicao: A condition in which the arch is flat all the time or flattens when bearing weight.

flatulence.definicao: Excess gas in the stomach or intestines that is expelled from the anus.

flavonoids.definicao: Chemicals found in fruits, vegetables, wine, and tea that may protect cells from damage and have health benefits.

flex.definicao: Bend a joint (for example, flexing the knees).

flexibility.definicao: A component of physical fitness that refers to the range of motion available at a joint.

flight-or-fight response.definicao: Changes that occur in the body, such as rapid breathing and heartbeat, when a person is confronted with a perceived physical or emotional threat. Also called the stress response.

floaters.definicao: Tiny spots or lines that appear in a person’s field of vision when the jelly-like fluid of the eye breaks down with age. They are usually harmless, but can signal serious eye problems.

flow.definicao: A term coined by positive psychology pioneer Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi to describe an effortless, active state of being during which one loses awareness of time, self, and distractions. Flow hinges on balancing the size of a challenge and the level of skill a person brings to it.

fluorescein angiography.definicao: A test that uses special dye and a camera to examine blood flow in the retina.

fluoride.definicao: A mineral that protects teeth from decay and cavities.

foam cells.definicao: Lipid-laden cells, named for their foamy appearance under the microscope. As foam cells build up on the inside of blood vessel walls, they form a plaque that can block blood flow.

focal neuropathy.definicao: Damage to a specific nerve, causing pain or numbness.

focus words.definicao: Peaceful, relaxing words or phrases used during stress relief exercises.

follicle.definicao: A group of cells that form a small sac.

follicle-stimulating hormone.definicao: A hormone released by the pituitary gland that stimulates the production of eggs in women and sperm in men.

follicular unit.definicao: A small bundle that includes one to four follicles, oil glands, a tiny muscle, and other tissue.

follicular unit transplantation.definicao: Transplantation of follicular units, which mimic natural hair growth.

folliculitis.definicao: An inflammation of the hair follicle.

food allergies.definicao: Sensitivities to certain foods that can cause symptoms ranging from the mild (like hives) to the life threatening (such as anaphylaxis).

forehead lift.definicao: Cosmetic surgery to minimize creases on the forehead and between the eyebrows, and to lift sagging eyebrows.

fovea.definicao: A small dimple in the middle of the retina that provides sharp central vision.

fracture.definicao: When you break a bone in your body, it’s called a fracture. There are lots of different types of fracture – some are simple fractures where the bone breaks but doesn’t come through your skin, but others are complicated fractures which need to be pinned together to make them heal properly.

frax tool.definicao: An algorithm for estimating the probability of breaking a bone because of low bone mass over a period of 10 years.

free fragment.definicao: Part of a disk in the back that has broken off from the main portion of the disk.

free radical.definicao: An unstable molecule in the body that plays a role in aging and can damage tissue; antioxidants help prevent free radical damage.

frequency.definicao: The pitch of a sound; measured by the speed at which sound waves vibrate.

frequency range.definicao: How much amplification a hearing aid produces in both high and low frequencies.

frequency response.definicao: The amplification that a hearing aid produces across different sound frequencies.

frontal lobe.definicao: Part of the brain that plays a role in determining consequences and choosing behaviors.

frontotemporal lobar degeneration.definicao: A brain disorder that can cause dementia, aphasia, neurotic behavior, and gradual changes in personality and emotional control.

frozen shoulder.definicao: Inflammation of various tissues of the shoulder, along with growth of abnormal bands of tissue that cause the shoulder to become so stiff that movement is severely limited.

fructose.definicao: A simple sugar found in corn syrup, honey, and many sweet fruits.

fsh.definicao: Abbreviation for follicle-stimulating hormone, a hormone released by the pituitary gland that stimulates the production of eggs in women and sperm in men.

functional gastrointestinal disorders.definicao: Gut problems that aren’t caused by an infection or structural problem with the gastrointestinal system.

functional incontinence.definicao: Recognition of the need to urinate but being unable to get to the bathroom in time due to mental or physical problems, such as limited mobility.

fundoplication.definicao: Surgery that restructures the stomach to prevent acid reflux.

fundus photography.definicao: Imaging test that provides multi-dimensional pictures of the back of the eyeball.

fungus.definicao: Organisms and microorganisms, such as yeasts and molds, that can live as a parasite on plants and animals.

gain.definicao: A hearing aid’s power, measured in the number of decibels that it can add to sound.

gait cycle.definicao: The cycle that the feet and legs make when walking, beginning when one heel hits the ground and ending when the same heel hits the ground again.

galactogogue.definicao: A substance that promotes breast milk production.

gamma-aminobutyric acid.definicao: A chemical messenger in the brain that may help decrease anxiety and promote slow-wave sleep. Often referred to as GABA.

ganglion.definicao: An abnormal but harmless mass of tissue, usually nerve cells.

ganglion cyst.definicao: A harmless sac of fluid on top of a joint or tendon, usually on the wrist or back of the hand.

gangrene.definicao: Death of tissue in part of the body because blood has stopped flowing there.

gastritis.definicao: Inflammation of the lining of the stomach.

gastroesophageal reflux disease.definicao: A condition in which food and acid flow back into the esophagus from the stomach, causing heartburn.

gastrointestinal.definicao: Relating to all or some of the organs of the digestive tract, from the mouth to the anus.

gene.definicao: Your genes are what makes you like your parents. Each cell in your body contains about 50,000 different genes. Each gene tells a particular cell how to work, so if you have a genetic problem, this could mean that certain cells don’t work properly.

gene therapy.definicao: Correction of a genetic defect by replacing an abnormal gene with a normal gene.

generic drug.definicao: A copy of a brand-name drug whose patent has expired. These drugs are less expensive than brand-name drugs.

genetic.definicao: Referring to inherited characteristics or genes.

genistein.definicao: An antioxidant chemical found in certain plants, like soybeans.

gerd.definicao: Abbreviation for gastroesophageal reflux disease, a condition in which food and acid flow back into the esophagus from the stomach, causing heartburn.

geriatric care manager.definicao: A trained medical professional who helps families who are caring for older adults.

geriatrician.definicao: A physician who specializes in the care of older patients.

gestational diabetes mellitus.definicao: A form of diabetes that appears during pregnancy.

gfr.definicao: Abbreviation for glomerular filtration rate, the rate at which the kidneys filter excess water and other wastes. A test by the same name is used to determine how well the kidneys are functioning.

giant cell arteritis.definicao: Inflammation and damage to blood vessels that supply the head and neck.

gingiva.definicao: The medical word for your gums.

gland.definicao: Glands are the areas of the body that give off hormones and enzymes.

glaucoma.definicao: A condition in which the pressure inside the eye is too high, causing eye damage.

gleason score.definicao: In men with prostate cancer, the Gleason score provides a rough estimate of how fast the cancer is growing.

glenohumeral joint.definicao: A shoulder joint that connects the ball of the humerus to the glenoid.

glenoid.definicao: The socket of the scapula that connects to the humerus at the shoulder.

glomerular filtration rate.definicao: The rate at which the kidneys filter excess water and other wastes. A test by the same name is used to determine how well the kidneys are functioning.

glomeruli.definicao: Tiny clusters of capillaries in the kidneys that filter waste products from the blood.

glucagon.definicao: A hormone produced in the pancreas that raises blood sugar levels.

glucocorticoids.definicao: Steroid hormones released by the adrenal gland when there seems to be a threat, and the stress response is triggered.

glucose.definicao: A simple sugar that is the body’s main source of energy.

glucose intolerance.definicao: Blood sugar levels that are higher than normal, but not yet high enough for a diagnosis of diabetes.

glutamate.definicao: A chemical messenger in the brain that may play a role in mood disorders and schizophrenia.

glutamic acid decarboxylase.definicao: A protein found in beta cells, the cells that create insulin.

glycemic index.definicao: A ranking of foods according to how quickly and how much they raise blood sugar.

glycemic load.definicao: A ranking of how much a typical serving of a particular food will raise blood sugar.

glycogen.definicao: The body’s fuel reserves. This substance, stored primarily in the liver and muscles, is later converted into glucose to provide cells with energy.

glycosylated hemoglobin.definicao: The product formed by the attachment of glucose (blood sugar) to hemoglobin (the oxygen-carrying protein in red blood cells). Usually referred to as hemoglobin A1c, or HbA1c.

gnrh.definicao: Abbreviation for gonadotropin-releasing hormone, a hormone responsible for the release of follicle-stimulating hormone and luteinizing hormone from the pituitary gland.

gnrh antagonists.definicao: Drugs used to treat prostate cancer by blocking the release of luteinizing hormone that do not cause a temporary surge in testosterone.

goblet cells.definicao: Cells that produce mucus that line the gastrointestinal tract and lungs.

goiter.definicao: An enlarged thyroid gland that creates a lump in the neck.

gonadotropin-releasing hormone.definicao: A hormone responsible for the release of follicle-stimulating hormone and luteinizing hormone from the pituitary gland.

gonioscopy.definicao: A test used to detect glaucoma that examines the area where fluid drains out of the eye.

gout.definicao: A form of arthritis that occurs when uric acid builds up in the joints; The big toe, knee, and ankle joints are most often affected.

graft.definicao: Transplanting tissue from one part of the body to another.

gram.definicao: A metric unit of weight equivalent to one-thousandth of a kilogram.

graves’ disease.definicao: An autoimmune disease that causes the thyroid gland to produce too much thyroid hormone. It is usually accompanied by an enlarged thyroid gland and swollen, bulging, red eyes that appear to stare, as well as occasional double vision and vision loss.

greenstick fracture.definicao: A fracture in a young, soft bone in which the bone bends and breaks only on the outer edge of the bend.

grief.definicao: A broad range of reactions to bereavement, including sadness, tears, shock, confusion, and anger, among others.
