growth factor.definicao: A substance produced by the body to stimulate tissue growth.

g spot.definicao: The area of sexually sensitive tissue located on the roof of the vagina just inside the opening. Also known as the Grafenberg spot.

guardianship.definicao: A legal process of appointing a person to make decisions about important matters (such as health and finances) for someone who is unfit to make those decisions on his or her own.

gum disease.definicao: Diseases including gingivitis and periodontitis that attack the gum tissue and the structures supporting the teeth. Also called periodontal disease.

gums.definicao: Your gums are what hold your teeth in place. They fit tightly around the base of each tooth to stop germs getting inside your jaw. Healthy gums are usually a light pink or brown colour, but if your gums bleed a lot when you brush your teeth, this could be a sign of gum disease.

hair bulb.definicao: The root of the hair shaft.

hair cells.definicao: Cells in the ear that transmit sound messages to the brain and play a vital role in hearing.

hair shaft.definicao: The portion of hair that extends beyond the surface of the skin. It contains three layersthe cuticle, cortex, and medulla (not always present).

hallucination.definicao: A perception of something that is not really there.

hammertoe.definicao: A sometimes painful condition in which the toe curls up and under (resembling a hammer).

happiness.definicao: Feelings of contentment or joy; the overall experience of pleasure and meaning in life.

happiness set-point.definicao: An individual's baseline level of happiness, determined largely by genetics, around which moods fluctuate. After reacting to positive or negative life changes, people tend to return to their happiness set-points.

harm reduction therapy.definicao: A treatment strategy aimed at minimizing the harm associated with an object of addiction. This strategic approach helps people learn how to limit the degree to which they use their object of addiction, or limit the risks associated with their use, but they do not necessarily stop altogether.

hashimoto's thyroiditis.definicao: A disease in which the body’s immune system prevents the thyroid gland from producing enough thyroid hormone.

hay fever.definicao: A commonly used term for allergic rhinitis—seasonal or year-round allergic condition marked by sneezing, runny nose, and congestion. The most common type of allergy, it is caused by an IgE-mediated immune response to inhaled airborne allergens.

hba1c.definicao: Abbreviation for hemoglobin A1c, the product formed by the attachment of glucose (blood sugar) to hemoglobin (a protein in red blood cells). A test for HbA1c is a useful measure of blood sugar control.

hdl.definicao: Abbreviation for high-density lipoprotein, the so-called good cholesterol. This lipoprotein (a substance made up of fats and protein) is believed to remove cholesterol from the arteries.

health care proxy.definicao: A legal form allowing a person to appoint someone else to make their medical decisions. Also known as a durable power of attorney for health care.

hearing aid.definicao: An electronic device worn in or behind the ear by people with hearing problems that makes sounds louder.

heart attack.definicao: The common term for a myocardial infarction. It refers to the damage that occurs when blood flow to part of the heart is blocked or drastically restricted. The blockage usually stems from the rupture of an atherosclerotic plaque.

heart block.definicao: The difficulty or inability of the electrical signal that triggers a heart contraction to pass through the atrioventricular node.

heart failure.definicao: The inability of the heart to pump enough blood to meet the needs of the body's organs.

heart murmur.definicao: An extra or unusual sound heard during the heartbeat. A murmur may or may not be a sign of a problem in the heart.

heart rate.definicao: The number of times the heart contracts in a minute, normally 60–100 times.

heartburn.definicao: A burning pain in the chest or throat, caused when stomach acid backs up into the esophagus.

heberden’s nodes.definicao: Bony bumps found on the finger joints in some people with osteoarthritis.

hedonic treadmill.definicao: The human tendency to adapt to new circumstances and eventually consider them to be normal, so the emotional effects (negative or positive) generated by a change fade over time.

heel spur.definicao: An abnormal growth of bone or calcium on the heel bone.

helicobacter pylori.definicao: Bacteria that damages the lining the stomach. It is to blame for most ulcers and stomach inflammation. Often called H. pylori.

helper t cells.definicao: Cells that help fight disease by activating and directing other immune system cells.

hematemesis.definicao: The vomiting of bright red blood, indicating bleeding in the upper digestive tract.

hematoma.definicao: This is a collection of blood outside of a blood vessel. One of the most common forms of hematoma is bruising on the skin.

hemianopia.definicao: Poor vision or blindness in half of the visual field, affecting one or both eyes.

hemiparesis.definicao: Muscle weakness on one side of the body.

hemiplegia.definicao: Paralysis on one side of the body.

hemochromatosis.definicao: A genetic condition in which the body absorbs and stores too much iron.

hemodialysis.definicao: The use of a machine to remove wastes and impurities from the blood when the kidneys are not working properly.

hemoptysis.definicao: Coughing up or spitting up blood from the lungs.

hemorrhage.definicao: Bleeding from a damaged blood vessel.

hemorrhagic stroke.definicao: A type of stroke that occurs when a blood vessel leaks or bursts inside the brain, cutting off the supply of oxygen and nutrition to that part of the brain.

hepa filter.definicao: Abbreviation for high-efficiency particulate air, a type of highly efficient air filter.

heparin.definicao: A drug that prevents blood from clotting.

herd immunity.definicao: Protection occurring when so many people in a region are immune to an infectious disease that it can’t spread to others.

herniated disk.definicao: When part of a spinal disk bulges out of a tear or weak spot in the disk’s tough outer shell. Also known as prolapsed disk.

herpes zoster.definicao: A painful blistering skin rash caused by the chicken pox virus; also known as shingles.

hertz.definicao: The measurement of a sound’s frequency.

hiatal hernia.definicao: When part of the stomach pushes upward into the chest through an abnormal opening in the diaphragm.

high blood pressure.definicao: When blood flowing through arteries pushes on artery walls with abnormally high force over a sustained period of time. Also called hypertension.

high-density lipoprotein.definicao: So-called good cholesterol. This lipoprotein (a substance made of fat and protein) removes cholesterol from arteries.

high-intensity focused ultrasound.definicao: A treatment that destroys tumors with heat generated by ultrasound energy.

hippocampus.definicao: Part of the brain that plays an important role in processing long-term memories.

hirsutism.definicao: Excessive facial or body hair in women.

histamine.definicao: A substance released by the immune system when it is exposed to an allergen. Histamines cause many allergy symptoms.

hives.definicao: An itchy rash of usually short duration. Also known as urticaria.

hla.definicao: Abbreviation for human leukocyte antigen, a protein found on the surface of white blood cells that helps the body recognize and fight foreign substances.

holter monitor.definicao: A small machine worn for a day or more to continuously record the heart’s electrical activity. Holter monitors are used to help diagnose heart rhythm problems.

homeostasis.definicao: The body’s ability to keep blood pressure, temperature, water levels, oxygen levels, and more set at the right levels for cells to survive.

homocysteine.definicao: An amino acid formed as part of the normal breakdown of protein.

homocystinuria.definicao: A rare genetic disease that causes blood levels of homocysteine to rise too high.

hormone therapy.definicao: Use of medications to boost levels of hormones that decrease with age.

hormones.definicao: These are chemical messengers that switch on and off processes in the body. For instance, starting puberty or producing more urine.

host.definicao: A person or other living organism that can be infected by a virus or other pathogen under natural conditions.

hot flash.definicao: A sudden, intense, hot feeling in the face or upper part of the body, along with rapid heartbeat, sweating, and flushing. A symptom of menopause.

hpa.definicao: Abbreviation for hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal axis, a system that controls many hormonal activities in the body, including the stress response.

human immunodeficiency virus.definicao: Usually abbreviated as HIV, the virus that leads to acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS). HIV damages immune cells so that they are no longer able to fight off other infections.

human leukocyte antigen.definicao: A protein found on the surface of white blood cells that helps the body recognize and fight foreign substances.

humectant.definicao: An agent used in moisturizers; binds water to the skin to promote hydration.

humoral immunity.definicao: Immunity from infection and disease that comes from the release of antibodies in the blood.

huntington's disease.definicao: An inherited disorder characterized by involuntary jerky movements and dementia.

hyaluronic acid.definicao: A hydrating sugar secreted by cells.

hydrogen breath test.definicao: A test used to diagnose gastrointestinal problems; it measures the amount of hydrogen in the breath, which rise when food isn’t being absorbed properly.

hydrogenation.definicao: The addition of hydrogen to a compound. Hydrogenation is used to solidify liquid vegetable oils. The process creates trans fats, which are harmful to the heart and blood vessels.

hydroxyapatite.definicao: A hard substance that is a major component of bones and teeth.

hygiene hypothesis.definicao: The theory that modern cleanliness means children are not exposed to as many germs at an early age, which results in a more allergies.

hyperaldosteronism.definicao: Overproduction of the hormone aldosterone, which causes the kidneys to retain sodium and water, often leading to high blood pressure.

hypercholesterolemia.definicao: High levels of cholesterol in the blood.

hyperglycemia.definicao: An abnormally high amount of sugar in the blood.

hyperinsulinemia.definicao: High levels of insulin in the bloodstream.

hyperlipidemia.definicao: High levels of blood lipids (fats and waxes such as cholesterol).

hyperopia.definicao: Difficulty seeing objects that are nearby; farsightedness.

hyperparathyroidism.definicao: Overproduction by the thyroid glands of parathyroid hormone.

hyperplasia.definicao: Increased production of cells in a normal tissue or organ; may be harmless or a sign of precancerous changes.

hyperplastic polyp.definicao: Noncancerous growths commonly found in the colon and rectum.

hypertensive cerebellar hemorrhage.definicao: A stroke in which there is bleeding in the cerebellum because high blood pressure has weakened arteries in the brain.

hypertensive intracerebral hemorrhage.definicao: A stroke in which high blood pressure causes a blood vessel deep in the brain to rupture.

hyperthyroidism.definicao: A condition in which the thyroid gland makes too much thyroid hormone.

hypertriglyceridemia.definicao: High levels of triglycerides in the blood. A normal triglyceride level is less than 150 mg/dL.

hyperuricemia.definicao: Abnormally high levels of uric acid in the blood.

hypnagogic hallucinations.definicao: Vivid dream-like sounds or images that occur while on the verge of falling asleep.

hypnogram.definicao: A diagram that summarizes the stages of sleep recorded in a sleep laboratory.

hypnotic.definicao: An agent that promotes and aids sleep.

hypoglycemia.definicao: A condition in which blood sugar drops to an abnormally low level.

hypogonadism.definicao: Extremely low levels of testosterone in circulation.

hypomania.definicao: A mild form of mania, in which a person has lots of energy, talks faster than normal, has racing thoughts, and elevated mood.

hypopnea.definicao: Breathing that is more shallow and slow than normal.

hypotension.definicao: The medical term for low blood pressure.

hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal axis.definicao: A system that controls many hormonal activities in the body, including the stress response. Often called the HPA axis.

hypothalamus.definicao: A small area in the brain that produces hormones that control body temperature, hunger, moods, the stress response, and other key functions.

hypothyroidism.definicao: A disease in which the thyroid gland does not make enough thyroid hormone.

hypoxia.definicao: When all or part of the body doesn’t get enough oxygen.

iatrogenic.definicao: Complications or poor effects caused by medical treatment.

ibd.definicao: Abbreviation for inflammatory bowel disease, a general term for two disorders—ulcerative colitis and Crohn's disease—that cause the intestines to become swollen and inflamed.

icd.definicao: Abbreviation for implantable cardioverter defibrillator, a device implanted in the chest and connected to the heart that delivers a shock to stop a potentially deadly rhythm and restore a normal (sinus) rhythm.

ice pick headache.definicao: Stabbing, very intense headaches that come on suddenly and are very brief.

Traduções.pt: dor de cabeça com picador de gelo *

idiopathic.definicao: A condition or disease of unknown origin.

ige.definicao: Abbreviation for immunoglobulin E, the substance responsible for most allergic reactions.

ileum.definicao: The final section of the small intestine.

iliopsoas muscles.definicao: Two muscles, running from the end of the spine to the thighbone, that are responsible for lifting the knee.

immediate hypersensitivity.definicao: A category of allergic reaction, triggered by specific allergens and involving IgE. The majority of allergic reactions to pollens, pets, dust, mold, food, and insect venom are of this type.

immobilize.definicao: To restrict the movement of a limb or other part of the body to help in healing.

immunity.definicao: The body’s ability to resist infection and disease.

immunization.definicao: Injection of harmless bacteria or viruses to spur the body to produce antibodies so it can resist a particular disease.

immunoglobulin.definicao: Substances made by the immune system that attack foreign substances. Also known as antibodies.

immunoglobulin e.definicao: The substance responsible for most allergic reactions.

immunologically privileged site.definicao: A part of the body—such as the eye or ovaries—where the immune system isn’t able to function because it may damage the tissue there.

immunosuppressant drug.definicao: Medication that stifles the body's immune response; often given after an organ transplant to prevent rejection of the new organ.

immunotherapy.definicao: Treating disease by enhancing or suppressing the body’s immune system.

impacted.definicao: Something firmly fixed into place, such as a wisdom tooth.

impaction.definicao: A mass of hardened feces blocking the rectum or colon.

impaired fasting glucose.definicao: Blood sugar levels that are higher than normal but not yet diabetic. This term is used when the high blood sugar levels are found with a fasting plasma glucose test.

Traduções.es: alteración de la glucosa en ayunas *

impaired glucose tolerance.definicao: Blood sugar levels that are higher than normal but not yet diabetic. This term is used when the high blood sugar levels are found with an oral glucose tolerance test.

impedance hearing testing.definicao: A test that sends sound waves to the eardrum to determine if a problem in the middle ear is causing hearing loss.

implantable cardioverter defibrillator.definicao: A device implanted in the chest and connected to the heart that delivers a shock to stop a potentially deadly rhythm and restore a normal (sinus) rhythm.

impotence.definicao: The inability of the penis to become firm or to stay firm enough to have sexual intercourse.

inactivated vaccines.definicao: Vaccines containing microbes that have been killed, and, therefore, are unable to cause disease.

incision.definicao: This is the medical word for the cut that the surgeon makes during an operation.

incontinence.definicao: Involuntary passing of urine or feces.

incubation period.definicao: The time between when a person is exposed to an infection and when symptoms appear.

infarct.definicao: An area of dead tissue caused by insufficient blood supply.

infarction.definicao: The death of tissue due to a lack of blood.

infection.definicao: The growth of harmful organisms that can cause disease, such as bacteria, in the body.

infectious arthritis.definicao: Arthritis caused by harmful organisms such as bacteria.

inferior myocardial infarction.definicao: Heart attack involving the back part of the heart-muscle wall.

inferior vena cava.definicao: The large vein that carries blood from the lower half of the body to the heart.

infiltrating cancer.definicao: A cancer that has spread from where it first developed into surrounding tissue.

inflammation.definicao: The body’s reaction to injury or infection. It is characterized by swelling, heat, redness, and pain.

inflammatory bowel disease.definicao: A general term for two disorders, ulcerative colitis and Crohn's disease, that cause the intestines to become swollen and inflamed. Often referred to as IBD.

ingrown toenail.definicao: A condition in which the side of a toenail pierces the skin, causing pain, swelling, and sometimes infection.

inhibitory neurochemical.definicao: A chemical that stops the transmission of a message from one nerve cell to another.

injectable fillers.definicao: Substances injected into the skin to fill in wrinkles or add plumpness to the lips.

injection.definicao: This is when a substance is put into your body using a needle. There are different types of injection – including intravenous (into a vein), intramuscular (into a muscle), intrathecal (into the fluid around your spinal cord) and subcutaneous (under the skin).

innate immunity.definicao: The body’s basic defenses against disease or infection that are present from birth.

inner ear.definicao: The deepest part of the ear, consisting of the cochlea and the labyrinth.

inoperable.definicao: A condition that cannot be treated by surgery.

insomnia.definicao: The inability to fall asleep or remain asleep long enough to feel rested.

insulin.definicao: Insulin is a hormone made in the pancreas. The body releases insulin to help it store glucose (a form of sugar) received from food. People with type 1 diabetes may need to inject insulin as their body does not correctly control its output of the hormone.

insulin resistance.definicao: A condition in which the body produces insulin but can’t use it properly. This leads to diabetes.

insulin-dependent diabetes.definicao: Now called type 1 diabetes. It occurs when the body doesn’t produce enough insulin to control blood sugar levels properly.

intense pulsed light.definicao: A device that emits broadband light to improve the look of the skin or remove unwanted hair.

intensity.definicao: In exercise, a measure of how hard the body is working. Cues like breathing, talking, and sweating help measure intensity through perceived exertion.

interferons.definicao: Proteins made by the body to protect against viruses, bacteria, and other harmful agents.

interleukins.definicao: A group of substances that act as messengers in the immune system.

intermediate-density lipoprotein.definicao: A type of lipoprotein. It consists of remnants of very-low-density lipoprotein (VLDL) that eventually turn into low-density lipoprotein (LDL).

intermittent claudication.definicao: Pain and cramping in the legs during exercise that is caused by narrowed or blocked arteries. Also known as peripheral artery disease of the legs.

international unit.definicao: An internationally accepted amount of a substance based on its biological activity or effect; used as a measurement for fat-soluble vitamins.

interpersonal therapy.definicao: Short-term talk therapy focused on identifying and addressing problems in current relationships and building social skills.

intervention.definicao: A planned, often group, meeting with a person with addiction, with the aim of overcoming denial and inducing the individual to seek treatment.

intervention study.definicao: A study that compares one group that receives a medication or other therapy (an intervention) and another group does not (controls).

intervertebral disk.definicao: One of the small, shock-absorbing cushions located between the vertebrae of the spine.

intervertebral foramen.definicao: The opening between vertebrae through which a spinal nerve exits the spinal column (pluralforamina).

intolerance.definicao: An adverse reaction that may have similar symptoms to an allergic reaction but does not engage the immune system, and thus is not an allergy.

intracerebral hemorrhage.definicao: A hemorrhagic stroke caused by the rupture of a blood vessel and subsequent bleeding into the brain tissue.

intraocular lens.definicao: A small artificial lens permanently fixed inside the eye to replace the natural lens during cataract surgery.

intrinsic sphincter deficiency.definicao: Inability of the urinary sphincter to close completely.

iodides.definicao: Salt compounds containing iodine that are used to control severe hyperthyroidism in special circumstances. They work by decreasing the thyroid gland’s production and secretion of thyroid hormone.

iris.definicao: This is the coloured part of your eye. It has a hole in the middle called your pupil that opens and closes to let light inside the eye.

irritants.definicao: Substances such as tobacco, wood smoke, perfumes, and others that cause allergy-like symptoms, although the response is not an allergic reaction.

ischemic heart disease.definicao: The most common form of heart disease, in which narrowed or blocked coronary arteries have difficulty supplying sections of the heart muscle with the blood they need (ischemia).

ischemic stroke.definicao: A stroke caused by an interruption in the flow of blood to the brain; almost always caused by a blood clot blocking a blood vessel.

islets of langerhans.definicao: Clusters of hormone-producing cells, including alpha and beta cells, that appear throughout the pancreas.

isolated systolic hypertension.definicao: A form of high blood pressure (hypertension) characterized by elevated systolic blood pressure and normal diastolic pressure.

isometric.definicao: An action in which a muscle generates force but does not contract or extend enough to move a joint, such as when pushing against an immovable object.

isotonic.definicao: An actions in which a muscle generates force by contracting or lengthening to move an attached joint through its range of motion, such as lifting a dumbbell from knee-height to shoulder-height.

iu.definicao: Commonly used abbreviation for international unit, an internationally accepted amount of a substance based on its biological activity or effect; used as a measurement for fat-soluble vitamins.

jejunum.definicao: The section of the small intestine between the duodenum and the ileum.

jet lag.definicao: A feeling of fatigue that occurs as the biological clock resets itself after traveling across time zones, usually by airplane.

joint.definicao: A junction in the body where bones are linked together.

julienne.definicao: To cut food into thin, matchstick strips.

Traduções.pt: Kegel: um exercício que ajuda a prevenir e tratar a incontinência, fortalecendo os músculos do assoalho pélvico. *
Traduções.es: Kegel: un ejercicio que ayuda a prevenir y tratar la incontinencia fortaleciendo los músculos del suelo pélvico. *
Traduções.en: kegel: an exercise that helps prevent and treat incontinence by strengthening pelvic floor muscles.

Traduções.pt: quelóide: uma cicatriz incomumente dura ou espessa que se forma após uma cirurgia ou lesão. *
Traduções.es: queloide: una cicatriz inusualmente dura o gruesa que se forma después de una cirugía o una lesión. *
Traduções.en: keloid: an unusually hard or thick scar that forms after surgery or an injury.

Traduções.pt: ceratectomia: um procedimento no qual um laser é usado para corrigir problemas de visão remodelando a córnea. *
Traduções.es: Queratectomía: un procedimiento en el que se utiliza un láser para corregir problemas de visión remodelando la córnea. *
Traduções.en: keratectomy: a procedure in which a laser is used to correct vision problems by reshaping the cornea.

keratin.definicao: A protein and the major component of the cuticle and cortex layers of hair; the same protein is found in nails, feathers, claws, and hooves.

keratinocytes.definicao: Cells of the epidermis that produce a tough protein called keratin and form a soft, protective sheet for the body.

keratoderma blennorrhagica.definicao: A skin rash that sometimes occurs along with an autoimmune condition called Reiter's syndrome.

keshan disease.definicao: Heart disease caused by a lack of selenium, an element that the body needs to function properly.

ketones.definicao: Substances produced when the body burns fat for energy or when the body doesn’t have enough insulin.

kidney failure.definicao: The final stage of chronic kidney disease. At this point, the kidneys can no longer eliminate waste products from the body.

kyphoplasty.definicao: A surgical procedure that eases or eliminates the pain of spinal fractures. It also restores vertebrae that have collapsed due to fractures to their normal size.

labile hypertension.definicao: Blood pressure that frequently fluctuates between normal and abnormal during the course of a day, often within only a few minutes.

labyrinth.definicao: The inner ear. It contains the cochlea, which is responsible for hearing, as well as structures that are needed for balance.

lactase.definicao: An enzyme that breaks down milk sugar (lactose) in the body.

lactic acidosis.definicao: A rare but potentially lethal condition in which blood lactic acid levels increase.

lactose.definicao: A sugar found in milk and dairy products.

lactose intolerance.definicao: The inability of the body to easily digest lactose, a sugar found in milk and dairy products.

lacunar stroke.definicao: A small ischemic stroke caused by the blockage of one of the smaller blood vessels in the brain; the most common effect is weakness or disability on one side of the body.

lamellar bone.definicao: Hard, dense tissue that forms the outer shell of bones. Also called compact bone.

lamina.definicao: One of the two thin, plate-like parts of each vertebra.

laminectomy.definicao: An operation in which all or part of one or both laminae is removed.

langerhans cells.definicao: Cells of the immune system that work in the skin to fight infection.

lanugo.definicao: Fine, soft hair that grows all over the body of a fetus and is typically shed before birth.

laparoscopy.definicao: Doctors make a really small cut on your body but you won't feel anything because you'll be under anaesthetic. They use this cut to put a really tiny camera inside your body in a bendy tube. This allows them to find out what's going on inside you.

laser.definicao: A machine that produces a bright beam of light. Lasers are used to cut skin and can also shrivel up blood vessels.

laser assisted uvula palatoplasty.definicao: A surgical procedure to ease snoring by removing or reshaping some of the tissues in the mouth (usually the uvula and soft palate) that vibrate and cause the noise of snoring.

Traduções.pt: palatoplastia de úvula assistida por laser *
Traduções.es: palatoplastia de úvula asistida por láser *

laser hair removal.definicao: Permanent hair removal technique that uses a laser to target and heat melanin in the hair shaft, which damages the hair follicle.

laser photocoagulation.definicao: Surgery that uses a laser to seal off blood vessels in the eye; used to treat a number of eye diseases.

laser prostatectomy.definicao: A surgical technique for treating an enlarged prostate (benign prostatic hyperplasia). It uses a high-energy laser to remove large amounts of prostate tissue with little bleeding.

latex allergy.definicao: An allergic reaction to the proteins found in natural rubber.

laxative.definicao: A drug or substance that induces bowel movements or makes the stool softer and looser.

ldl.definicao: Abbreviation for low-density lipoprotein. This so-called bad cholesterol can build up on artery walls, narrowing the artery and making a heart attack or stroke more likely.

learned insomnia.definicao: When fear of not sleeping develops after a short period of not sleeping well, and this anxiety causes ongoing trouble falling or staying asleep.

led photomodulation.definicao: Use of a panel of light-emitting diodes (LEDs) to stimulate skin cells and improve the look of the skin.

left anterior descending coronary artery.definicao: One of the main arteries that supplies blood to the heart; it runs down the front surface of the heart.

left atrium.definicao: The left upper chamber of the heart.

left circumflex coronary artery.definicao: One of the main arteries that supplies blood to the heart; it curves around the back of the heart.

left ventricle.definicao: The left lower chamber of the heart. It pumps blood out of the heart to other organs in the body.

left ventricular hypertrophy.definicao: A thickening of the wall of the lower left chamber of the heart, which is responsible for pumping blood to organs throughout the body.

left-ventricular assist device.definicao: A surgically implanted pump that augments the pumping action of the left ventricle.

lensometer.definicao: A device used to check the prescription of eyeglasses.

leptin.definicao: A hormone produced by fat cells that acts on the brain to suppress appetite and burn stored fat.

lesion.definicao: An infected, diseased, or wounded area of tissue.

leukotriene blockers.definicao: Asthma medications that work by blocking leukotrienes, chemicals made in the body as part of an allergic reaction.

leukotriene modifiers.definicao: Asthma medications that work by blocking the production or action of leukotrienes, chemicals made in the body as part of an allergic reaction.

leukotrienes.definicao: Chemicals that cause airways to swell when an allergic reaction occurs or in diseases like asthma.

levothyroxine sodium.definicao: A man-made version of the thyroid hormone thyroxine.

lh.definicao: Abbreviation for luteinizing hormone, a hormone that controls ovulation in women. In men, luteinizing hormone triggers production of testosterone.

lice.definicao: A blood-sucking parasite known as Pediculus humanus capitis that can cause an itchy scalp; infestations are highly contagious and especially common in school-age children.

ligament.definicao: A band of tissue that holds the ends of bone together. You can sprain or tear your ligaments by twisting awkwardly but they can be treated.

ligature.definicao: Any material that is tied around a blood vessel to stop it from bleeding.

lignans.definicao: Antioxidant chemicals found in seeds like flax and sesame, as well as some fruits, vegetables, and grains.

limbic system.definicao: A group of structures in the brain that help control memory, emotions, sexual arousal, and motivation.

limbus.definicao: The border between the cornea and the white of the eye.

liothyronine sodium.definicao: A man-made version of the thyroid hormone triiodothyronine.

lipids.definicao: Fats, oils, and waxes that serve as building blocks for cells or as energy sources. Lipids are also capable of accumulating in the artery walls to form plaque.

lipoatrophy.definicao: Dents or depressions in the skin that are caused by a loss of fatty tissue.

lipoma.definicao: A noncancerous tumor or growth composed of fat cells.

lipoprotein.definicao: A combination of fat (lipid) and protein molecules bound together as packages. The combination allows fats and cholesterol to move easily through the blood.

lipoprotein analysis.definicao: A test that measures the amount of triglycerides, total cholesterol, HDL (good cholesterol), and LDL (bad cholesterol) in a person’s blood.

lipoprotein(a).definicao: A molecule made up of fat and protein that is very similar to harmful LDL.

liposuction.definicao: A cosmetic procedure that removes fat from an area of the body.

live attenuated vaccines.definicao: Vaccines made from a weakened virus or microbe. These weakened viruses and microbes don't cause disease; instead they teach the body to recognize the substance as harmful and destroy it if there is contact with it in the future.

liver.definicao: The liver is the largest organ in your body. Its job is to produce and keep control of the chemicals circulating in your body, removing any waste products from the blood. In adults, the liver weighs around one kilogram.

living will.definicao: A legal document that states what a person would and wouldn’t want if he or she is no longer able to make health care decisions.

lobar hemorrhage.definicao: Bleeding that occurs in the white matter of the brain beneath the cerebral cortex.

lobotomy.definicao: A surgical procedure to severe one or more branches of nerves into the frontal lobe of the brain.

localized.definicao: In reference to cancer, generally means cancer that is limited to a specific gland or other tissue, without any distant spread; an organ-confined cancer.

locus ceruleus.definicao: An area of the brain stem that helps control the brain’s alertness, responses to certain stimuli, and stress and anxiety levels.

long-term memory.definicao: A memory that lasts from a few minutes to decades.

low-calorie diet.definicao: A weight-loss plan that limits calories to 800–1,500 a day.

low-density lipoprotein.definicao: So-called bad cholesterol. If there is too much LDL in the blood, it can collect on artery walls, narrowing them and making heart attacks and strokes more likely.

lower esophageal sphincter.definicao: A ring of muscle where the esophagus and stomach meet. It relaxes to let food into the stomach and closes to prevent stomach acids from backing up and irritating the esophagus.

lumbar spine.definicao: The lower portion of the spine. It includes the five lowermost bones (vertebrae) of the spine and is the start of the lower back.

lumbar stenosis.definicao: Narrowing of the spinal canal in the lower portion of the spine (known as the lumbar spine).

lumen.definicao: This is the space inside a tube. In medicine, it's usually used to refer to the inside of a tubular organ, like your intestines, or the inside of a tube to give medicine, like a central line.

lutein.definicao: A natural substance found in green leafy vegetables.

luteinizing hormone.definicao: A hormone that controls ovulation in women. In men, luteinizing hormone triggers production of testosterone.

luteinizing hormone-releasing hormone ag.definicao: A drug that slows the production of hormones by the testicles in men or the ovaries in women.

Traduções.pt: agonista do hormônio liberador do hormônio luteinizante *
Traduções.es: agonista de la hormona liberadora de hormona luteinizante *

lvad.definicao: Abbreviation for left-ventricular assist device, a surgically implanted pump that augments the pumping action of the left ventricle.

lyme disease.definicao: An infectious disease transmitted by a tick bite.

lymph nodes.definicao: Small, bean-shaped organs that filter germs and foreign matter out of the body. Also called lymph glands.

lymphatic system.definicao: This is part of the immune system. Lymphatic vessels drain lymph away from the body and back into the bloodstream.

lymphedema.definicao: Blockage in or damage to the lymphatic systems, causing lymphatic fluid to build up in tissues, making them swell.

lymphocyte.definicao: This is a type of white blood cell that fights infection. There are two types – T cells and B cells. B cells protect against second attacks of infectious diseases like measles.

lymphoma.definicao: A type of cancer that affects cells in the lymphatic system.

macrocytic anemia.definicao: The presence of larger-than-normal red blood cells in circulation—even though there are too few of them—caused by lack of folate and vitamin B12.

macronutrients.definicao: Substances that provide energy and that the body needs for growth. The main categories arefat, carbohydrate, and protein.

macrophage.definicao: A type of white blood cell that destroys cell debris, bacteria, and foreign agents.

macula.definicao: The area in the center of the retina that produces sharp, clear central vision and allows one to see fine detail.

macular degeneration.definicao: An eye disease that slowly destroys sharp, clear central vision.

macular edema.definicao: The build-up of fluid in the macula caused by fluid leaking from blood vessels in the eye. It can blur and damage vision.

magenblase syndrome.definicao: Swallowing too much air during a meal, causing excessive gas and discomfort. Also known as stomach bubble syndrome.

magnetic resonance imaging.definicao: A scan that creates detailed pictures of internal organs; commonly referred to as MRI. Magnetic resonance imaging uses radio waves, a strong magnetic field, and a computer to produce images of organs and internal tissues.

maintenance of wakefulness test.definicao: A test to measure sleepiness during the day. A tester measures how long it takes a person who is sitting up in a chair or bed to fall asleep after he or she has been asked to stay awake.

Traduções.es: prueba de mantenimiento de la vigilia *

major depression.definicao: Depression that interferes with daily life for an extended period. Episodes of major depression during bereavement can be distinguished from normal sadness by such symptoms as persistent feelings of worthlessness, thoughts about death, feelings of guilt, persistent trouble functioning, and marked mental and physical sluggishness.

major histocompatibility complex molecul.definicao: Molecules that help protect the body from foreign substances. These molecules display proteins on the surface of cells so that protective immune system cells can kill the protein if it is harmful to the body.

Traduções.pt: molécula do complexo principal de histocompatibilidade *
Traduções.es: molécula del complejo mayor de histocompatibilidad *

maladaptive stress response.definicao: An unhealthy physiological response to stressors, in which the stress response often does not turn off even when the stressor disappears.

malaise.definicao: A general feeling of illness that can be a sign of disease.

malignant.definicao: This word is used to describe a disease or condition that gets worse at time goes by, or which spreads to other parts of the body.

malignant hypertension.definicao: A dangerous type of high blood pressure marked by an unusually sudden rise in blood pressure to very high levels, often accompanied by headache, blurred vision, and seizures.

malnutrition.definicao: Failure to eat or to properly absorb the nutrients needed for good health.

maois.definicao: Abbreviation for monoamine oxidase inhibitors, medications used to treat depression. They work by making the chemical messengers serotonin and norepinephrine more available.

mast cell.definicao: A cell involved in allergic reactions. When stimulated, it releases chemicals like histamine that signal infection and cause inflammation.

mastoid bone.definicao: The bone in the skull behind the ear.

mastopexy.definicao: A cosmetic surgery to reshape and lift drooping breasts. Commonly known as a breast lift.

maximizer.definicao: A person who typically evaluates all options before making a decision, in an effort to identify the perfect choice, and who never settles for second-best.

meal plan.definicao: A detailed guide outlining the amounts and types of food a person should eat each day.

medicaid.definicao: A government program that offers health care for low-income Americans of any age.

medicare.definicao: A government program that offers health care for Americans ages 65 and older.

medigap insurance.definicao: Health insurance policies that fill in the holes in Medicare coverage.

medulla.definicao: Refers to the middle of something.

megaloblastic anemia.definicao: Fewer than normal healthy red blood cells in circulation, caused by a lack of folate or vitamin B12. Red cells become large and deformed, and are unable to carry oxygen efficiently.

meglitinides.definicao: A type of medication taken to treat type 2 diabetes.

melanin.definicao: The pigment that gives our skin, hair and eye colour. The amount of melanin in your skin depends on your race and whether you’re exposed to sunlight a lot.

melanocytes.definicao: Cells located deep in the epidermis that produce melanin, the pigment that colors skin.

melanoma.definicao: The most dangerous type of skin cancer.

melatonin.definicao: A hormone that regulates the body’s sleep-wake cycle.

membrane.definicao: A thin layer of tissue that surrounds or lines organs or cavities.

memory t cells and b cells.definicao: Immune cells that remember harmful agents that have entered the body in the past. When they spot the substance again, they spur the immune system to eliminate the invader.

Traduções.pt: células t de memória e células b *
Traduções.es: células t de memoria y células b *
Traduções.en: memory t cells and b cells

ménière’s disease.definicao: An illness caused by a fluid imbalance in the inner ear.

meninges.definicao: These are the layers of tissue that cover your brain and spinal cord. If the meninges become inflamed, this is called meningitis.

meningitis.definicao: This is a serious illness where the meninges become inflamed, usually because of an infection. Some types of meningitis are very serious indeed, and need treatment very quickly.

menopause.definicao: The point marking the end of menstruation, officially designated as one year after a woman’s final period.

metabolic equivalents.definicao: Units used to estimate the oxygen consumption, or metabolic cost, of physical activity, and, hence, its intensity. One metabolic equivalent (MET) is the estimated energy cost of the body at rest.

metabolic syndrome.definicao: A cluster of risk factors that accelerate the progression of heart disease.

metabolism.definicao: The chemical reactions that occur in all living organisms to maintain life. An example is converting food into energy that the body needs to function.

metastasis.definicao: The spread of cancer cells from the primary site to another part of the body.

metered-dose inhaler.definicao: A device that delivers a specific dose of an inhaled asthma medication.

methanobrevibacter smithii.definicao: Bacteria in the gut that help with the digestion of complex sugars.

mets.definicao: Abbreviation for metabolic equivalents, units used to estimate the oxygen consumption, or metabolic cost, of physical activity, and, hence, its intensity. One MET is the estimated energy cost of the body at rest.

mhc molecule.definicao: Abbreviation for major histocompatibility complex molecule, molecules that help protect the body from foreign substances. These molecules display proteins on the surface of cells so that protective immune system cells can kill the protein if it is harmful to the body.

microalbuminuria.definicao: Leakage of small amounts of a protein called albumin into the urine caused by kidney disease or damage.

microaneurysm.definicao: A tiny bulge that develops in the wall of a blood vessel.

microdermabrasion.definicao: A cosmetic procedure in which tiny crystals under high pressure are sprayed on the face. This buffs away the outer layer of skin, eliminates fine lines, and improves the look of the skin.

microgram.definicao: A unit of mass, equal to one-thousandth of a milligram. Abbreviated as mcg.

micronized.definicao: Reducing a substance to very small particles.

micronutrients.definicao: Vitamins and minerals needed to maintain normal body functions and prevent certain illnesses.

microvascular disease.definicao: A condition in which the smallest blood vessels in the walls of the heart are narrowed or inelastic.

micturition.definicao: Emptying the bladder. Also called urination or voiding.

middle ear.definicao: The air-filled cavity behind the eardrum that contains the three small bones that transmit sound vibrations to the inner ear.

migraine headache.definicao: A severe headache with pain that usually begins on one side of the head. Symptoms may include visual disturbances (called aura), nausea, vomiting, and sensitivity to light or noise.

migraine with aura.definicao: A severe headache preceded by visual disturbances such as flashing lights, seeing lines, or a blind spot.

migraine without aura.definicao: A severe headache that is not preceded by visual disturbances such as flashing lights. Also known as common migraine.

mild cognitive impairment.definicao: The loss of some brain functions, such as memory, thinking, or language, that is noticeable, but doesn’t interfere with ability to carry out daily tasks.

milligram.definicao: A metric unit of weight equivalent to one-thousandth of a gram. Abbreviated as mg.

mindfulness.definicao: A practice with its roots in Buddhism that encourages people to be more fully aware of the present moment. Often achieved through meditation.

mindfulness meditation.definicao: A form of meditation with roots in ancient Buddhist practice through which a person has a calm awareness of his or her body and feelings and is fully engaged in the present; also called insight meditation.

mindfulness-based cognitive behavioral t.definicao: A well-established acceptance-based therapy, used principally in treatment of depression and anxiety.

Traduções.es: Terapia cognitivo-conductual basada en la atención plena. *

mindlessness.definicao: Acting without full attention to one's surroundings, behavior, or internal experience.

miotic.definicao: An eye drop that constricts the pupil; used to treat glaucoma.

mitochondria.definicao: Small structures within cells that create break down nutrients and create energy for cells. Known as the power producers or energy factories of cells.

mitral valve.definicao: The valve that controls the one-way flow of blood from the left atrium to the left ventricle.

mitral valve prolapse.definicao: A valve problem in which one or both of the mitral valve flaps collapse backward into the left atrium. This may allow a small amount of blood to leak backward (regurgitate) through the valve.

mitral valve stenosis.definicao: A narrowing of the mitral valve opening that limits blood flow from the left atrium to the left ventricle.

monoamine oxidase inhibitors.definicao: Medications used to treat depression. They work by making the chemical messengers serotonin and norepinephrine more available.

monoclonal antibody.definicao: An antibody is a protein molecule that can bind to a virus and mark it for destruction by the immune system. A monoclonal antibody is a man-made substance used to treat some viral and other diseases.

monocytes.definicao: White blood cells that protect the body from disease by attacking and consuming foreign particles.

monounsaturated fat.definicao: A type of fat abundant in vegetable oils such as olive, peanut, sesame, and canola oils. Monounsaturated fats don’t raise levels of unhealthy LDL cholesterol, and may even lower it.

morton’s neuroma.definicao: A thickening of nerve tissue between the toes that causes irritation, tingling, or a burning pain in the ball of the foot.

motilin.definicao: A hormone that helps the small intestine contract and move food through the digestive tract.

motility.definicao: The ability of the digestive tract to move its contents.

motor neuron.definicao: A nerve cell that directs activity in a specific group of muscle fibers.

motor unit.definicao: The pairing of a nerve cell and the group of muscle fibers it commands.

mucosa.definicao: Tissue that lines the tube-like structures of the body such as the respiratory and gastrointestinal tracts.

mucous cysts.definicao: Small cysts that form between the nail bed and the top joint of the finger.

mucous membrane.definicao: The lining of many parts of the body, like your nose and mouth. They let out a fluid (mucus) that keeps everything moist.

multi-infarct dementia.definicao: Memory loss and impaired thinking caused by tiny strokes that are often too small to notice until a sizable area of the brain is affected.

multinodular goiter.definicao: An enlargement of the thyroid gland with more than one lump or nodule appearing on the neck.

multiple sclerosis.definicao: An autoimmune disease in which the body’s immune system mistakenly attacks myelin, the substance that covers nerve fibers.

multiple sleep latency test.definicao: A sleep test to measure daytime sleepiness. It times how quickly a person falls asleep when asked to rest in a quiet, darkened room during the day.

Traduções.pt: teste de latência múltipla do sono *
Traduções.es: prueba de latencia múltiple del sueño *

murmur.definicao: An sound heard during an examination of the heart caused by abnormal flow of blood through heart chambers or valves. Many heart murmurs do not indicate heart problems; others do.

muscle fatigue.definicao: Weakness felt in muscles when they have been tired out.

muscle fibers.definicao: Cells bundled together to make up muscle tissue. Also known as muscle cells.

muscle-contraction headache.definicao: A headache characterized by constant pressure, mild to moderate pain, and the feeling that a tight band is squeezing the head. Also known as a tension headache.

Traduções.pt: dor de cabeça por contração muscular *
Traduções.es: dolor de cabeza por contracción muscular *

muscular endurance.definicao: The ability of muscle to continue to perform without stopping because of fatigue.

muscularis.definicao: The thin layer of smooth muscle lining of the colon or rectum.

musculoskeletal.definicao: Related to the muscles and the skeleton.

muse.definicao: Abbreviation for medicated urethral system for erection. In this therapy, a small drug pellet is inserted into the tip of the penis to produce an erection.

mutation.definicao: The process by which a change occurs in genetic material and is inherited by the next generation.

myalgia.definicao: Pain or tenderness in a muscle.

myasthenia.definicao: An abnormal weakness in a muscle or group of muscles.

mydriatic.definicao: A type of drug that widens the pupil.

myelin.definicao: A fatty material that surrounds and protects some nerve fibers.

myelography.definicao: A test that uses a special dye and X-rays to detect spinal cord problems. The dye is injected into the space surrounding the spinal cord, making the spinal cord, spinal canal, and nerve roots appear in detail on the X-ray.

myelopathy.definicao: A disorder in which the spinal cord is compressed, diseased, or damaged.

myocardial infarction.definicao: Medical term for heart attack, the sudden death of part of the heart muscle from lack of oxygen.

myocardial rupture.definicao: Tearing of one of the walls of the heart. It usually occurs immediately after a heart attack.

myocardium.definicao: The middle layer of heart tissue. The muscular myocardium is sandwiched between the outer layer (epicardium) and the inner layer (endocardium).

myofibrils.definicao: Long interlocking strands that make up muscle fibers.

myofilaments.definicao: The fundamental muscle proteins that form myofibrils. Myofilaments slide over one another, bunching up and generating force, when a muscle contracts.

myopia.definicao: Nearsightedness. An optical error in which light rays meet and focus before reaching the retina, making objects that are far away appear blurry.

myosin.definicao: A protein that helps muscle contract and relax.

nanograms per milliliter.definicao: A small quantity of a substance; equivalent to one-billionth of a gram (454 grams make 1 pound) in one-thousandth of a liter (1 liter is approximately 1 quart). Abbreviated as ng/ml.

narcolepsy.definicao: A sleep disorder that causes extreme sleepiness and uncontrollable sleep attacks, making a person fall asleep at inappropriate times during the day.

nasolabial folds.definicao: Lines in the skin leading from the nose to the outer corners of the mouth. Also known as smile or laugh lines.

natural killer cells.definicao: A type of white blood cell of the immune system. These cells destroy other cells that fail to display the right chemical flags signaling that they are normal cells.

natural recoverers.definicao: People who overcome addiction without treatment or formal self-help programs.

nebulizer.definicao: A nebulizer is a bit like an inhaler, but you wear a facemask. The machine blows some medicine into the facemask so you can breathe it in.

necrosis.definicao: The premature death of living cells or tissues.

needle biopsy.definicao: Use of a hollow needle to remove a small sample of tissue for examination.

neoadjuvant therapy.definicao: A helper treatment given before a primary treatment is started, such as when chemotherapy is done before surgery in order to shrink a tumor.

neoplasm.definicao: An abnormal growth of tissue, either cancerous or benign.

nerve block.definicao: Injection of a medication into one or more nerves to relieve pain.

nerve growth factor.definicao: A molecule in the body that promotes the growth and repair of nerve cells.

nerve sparing.definicao: When referring to prostatectomy, the surgical procedure that preserves the nerves needed to allow the penis to become erect.

neuralgia.definicao: A burning or stabbing pain that follows the path of a nerve.

neuritic plaques.definicao: Clumps of sticky proteins found in the brains of people with Alzheimer's disease.

neurofibrillary tangles.definicao: Twisted strands of proteins that are found inside the dead or dying nerve cells of people with Alzheimer's disease.

neuroleptic agents.definicao: Powerful tranquilizing drugs used to treat schizophrenia.

neurologist.definicao: This is a special type of doctor who will help you if you're having problems with your nervous system.

neuromuscular junction.definicao: The tiny space between the end of a nerve and the surface of a muscle.

neuropathy.definicao: Nerve damage and resulting loss of sensation, movement, or other function.

neuropeptides.definicao: Small proteins that aid in transmitting signals between nerve cells.

neurosyphilis.definicao: A rare infection of the brain or spinal cord that occurs when syphilis goes untreated for many years.

neurotransmitter.definicao: A chemical messenger released by nerve cells that transmits messages to nearby other nerve cells.

neurotransmitter receptors.definicao: Cell structures (usually proteins) that recognize specific neurotransmitters and bind to them. Once bound, a receptor often changes shape, causing a cascade of chemical events within the cell. These events can alter which genes are turned on or off and can make the cell more or less likely to release its neurotransmitters.

neutral alignment.definicao: Keeping the body in a straight line from head to toe except for the slight natural curves of the spine.

neutral posture.definicao: A standing or seated position in which the chin is parallel to the floor; the shoulders, hips, and knees are at even heights; and the knees and feet point straight ahead.

neutral spine.definicao: A position in which the back is straight except for the slight natural curves of the spine.

neutropenia.definicao: An abnormally low number of white blood cells.

neutrophils.definicao: White blood cells that seek out and engulf foreign cells.

nitrates.definicao: Medications that widen blood vessels; usually used to treat chest pain from angina and other heart problems.

nitric oxide.definicao: A compound produced by the endothelium (the lining of the interior walls of arteries) that helps widen blood vessels and counteract high blood pressure. Also called endothelium-derived relaxing factor.

nitroglycerin.definicao: A drug that relaxes blood vessels and increases the supply of blood and oxygen to the heart while reducing its workload. It is commonly used to treat angina.

nk.definicao: Abbreviation for natural killer cells, a type of white blood cell of the immune system. These cells destroy other cells that fail to display the right chemical flags signaling that they are normal cells.

nmda receptor.definicao: Abbreviation for the N-methyl-D-aspartame receptor, a molecule on the surface of a brain cell that admits calcium when activated by the chemical messenger glutamate.

n-methyl-d-aspartame receptor.definicao: A molecule on the surface of a brain cell that admits calcium when activated by the chemical messenger glutamate.

no.definicao: Abbreviation for nitric oxide, a compound produced by the endothelium (the lining of the interior walls of arteries) that helps widen blood vessels and counteract high blood pressure. Also called endothelium-derived relaxing factor.

nociceptors.definicao: Nerve endings that detect pain and transmit pain information to the brain and spinal cord.

nocturia.definicao: Waking up more than once during the night to urinate.

nodule.definicao: A small rounded bump or knot of tissue.

nomogram.definicao: A chart or graph of mathematical calculations of risk; used in making treatment recommendations and predicting outcomes.

non-hdl cholesterol.definicao: The sum of all cholesterol types other than high-density lipoprotein (HDL). These include very-low-density lipoprotein, low-density lipoprotein, and intermediate-density lipoprotein.

non-insulin-dependent diabetes.definicao: Now called type 2 diabetes. A disease in which levels of blood sugar (glucose) are too high initially because cells can’t properly use insulin (a hormone that helps cells absorb glucose from the bloodstream). Over time the production of insulin may decline.

noninvasive test.definicao: A test that does not require any medical instruments to break the skin or enter the body.

nonketotic hyperglycemic hyperosmolar sy.definicao: A rare and very serious condition associated with type 2 diabetes. Symptoms include extremely high (more than 800 mg/dl) blood sugar levels, severe dehydration, and changes in mental status, ultimately resulting in coma.

nonproliferative retinopathy.definicao: A condition in which the walls of the small blood vessels in the retina leak serum and tiny pockets of swelling form in the walls of blood vessels. Also called background retinopathy.

non-rem sleep.definicao: The sleep phase that includes deep sleep, the type considered most important for preventing daytime sleepiness.

nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug.definicao: A drug that reduces swelling and pain.

noradrenaline.definicao: A hormone produced by adrenal glands that puts the body on heightened alert when a threat is perceived (the fight-or-flight response). Also known as norepinephrine.

norepinephrine.definicao: A hormone produced by adrenal glands that puts the body on heightened alert when a threat is perceived (the fight-or-flight response). Also known as noradrenaline.

normal-pressure hydrocephalus.definicao: A buildup of fluid in the brain that causes the brain to swell, and leads to slowing of mental function, trouble walking, and a loss of bladder control.

nsaid.definicao: Abbreviation for nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug, a drug that reduce swelling and pain.

nuclear tests.definicao: Tests that use tiny amounts of short-lived radioactive substances that can target particular organs or cell receptors to diagnose disease.

nucleus accumbens.definicao: Part of the brain’s reward pathway that is most tightly and consistently responsive to pleasure. Also known as the pleasure center.

nucleus pulposus.definicao: The gel-like shock-absorbing central portion of each spinal disc.

nutraceutical.definicao: Dietary supplement containing concentrated forms of a presumed bioactive substance originally derived from food and used to enhance health in dosages exceeding those normally obtainable from food.

nutrients.definicao: Substances in foods that the body needs to survive.

obesity.definicao: A body weight that is much higher than is healthy. Defined as having a body mass index of 30 or more. Obesity puts a person at greater risk of developing numerous chronic diseases.

object of addiction.definicao: The psychoactive drug or rewarding behavior with which a person with addiction has a pathological relationship.

obstructive sleep apnea.definicao: A disorder marked by heavy snoring and interrupted breathing during sleep. It increases the risk of developing high blood pressure and having a stroke and is more common in people who are obese.

occipital lobe.definicao: The region in the back of the brain responsible for visual processing.

occlusion.definicao: The closing or blocking of a hollow organ or body part.

occult.definicao: Something not visible to the naked eye but seen under a microscope or through lab tests.

omega-3 fatty acids.definicao: Beneficial fats, also known as n-3 fatty acids. These are polyunsaturated fat found in fatty fish, such as salmon.

omega-6 fatty acids.definicao: Fatty acids found in certain foods that the body needs for good health but can’t make on its own. Also known as n-6 fatty acids.

oncogene.definicao: A gene that, under certain conditions, can cause cancer.

oncologist.definicao: A physician who deals with the diagnosis and treatment of cancer. There are three types—medical oncologists, radiation oncologists, and surgical oncologists.

ondine's curse.definicao: A rare and potentially fatal disorder in which a person may stop breathing, especially at night. Also called congenital central hypoventilation syndrome.

open prostatectomy.definicao: A surgical procedure in which an enlarged prostate is removed through an incision in the abdomen.

ophthalmologist.definicao: A physician who specializes in treating the eye and eye disease.

ophthalmoscope.definicao: An instrument with a light and mirrors for examining the deep interior of the eye.

opiate.definicao: Any painkilling drug such as morphine or codeine derived from the opium poppy.

opioid.definicao: Any narcotic, natural or synthetic, that behaves in the body like an opium-derived drug.

optic disk.definicao: The front surface of the optic nerve, where all the retinal nerve fibers come together to carry an image to the brain.

optic nerve.definicao: A cable of specialized nerve fibers that transmit visual impulses from the eye to the brain.

optician.definicao: A technician who helps select and fit eyeglasses or contact lenses for people with vision problems.

optimism.definicao: A characteristic frame of mind that leads a person to expect positive outcomes and to view the world as a positive place.

optometrist.definicao: A health care professional licensed to examine the eye, and diagnose and treat some eye diseases.

oral glucose tolerance test.definicao: A test to check for diabetes. It involves fasting overnight and having blood sugar levels checked before and after drinking a sugary solution.

Traduções.pt: teste oral de tolerância à glicose *
Traduções.es: test oral de tolerancia a la glucosa *

oral mucosa.definicao: The layer of soft pinkish tissue that lines the interior of the mouth.

orbit.definicao: The bony socket that holds the eyeball.

orbital irradiation.definicao: X-ray treatment to the eye; sometimes used in more serious cases of Graves’ eye disease.

orchiectomy.definicao: Surgery to remove the testicles. Usually done to remove a cancerous testicle or to lower testosterone levels and slow or halt the growth of prostate cancer.

organic matrix.definicao: The protein framework of bone tissue.

organonitrile.definicao: A chemical found in cruciferous vegetables that may have anti-cancer properties.

orgasm.definicao: The series of pleasurable, rhythmic muscle contractions that mark the peak of sexual arousal and the release of muscle tension.

orthopedist.definicao: A medical doctor who specializes in correcting disorders of the bones, joints, muscles, and tendons.

orthosis.definicao: A custom shoe insert that helps cushion or realign the foot.

orthostatic hypotension.definicao: A sudden drop in blood pressure upon standing or getting out of bed, causing dizziness.

osseointegration.definicao: A process in which bone heals around an implant to create a stable anchor.

ossicles.definicao: Three bones in the middle ear that move in response to sound vibrations.

ossification.definicao: The process by which bone is formed.

osteoarthritis.definicao: A joint disease in which the cartilage that lines the joints slowly deteriorates. Also called degenerative joint disease.

osteocytes.definicao: A cell that is embedded in fully formed bone.

osteomalacia.definicao: A condition in which bones are soft and weak, usually due to a lack of vitamin D or an inability of the body to use vitamin D properly.

osteomyelitis.definicao: A bone infection caused by bacteria or fungi.

osteons.definicao: The building blocks of compact bone, the hard, tightly-packed tissue that forms the outer shell of bones.

osteopath.definicao: A doctor licensed to practice medicine, perform surgery, and prescribe drugs. The training is similar to that of a regular M.D., but more emphasis is placed on the importance of the musculoskeletal system and the body’s ability to heal itself.

osteophyte.definicao: An outgrowth of bone on a joint or spinal disk; commonly called a bone spur.

osteoporosis.definicao: Significant thinning and weakening of bones over time, making them vulnerable to breaks.

osteotomy.definicao: An operation in which bone is cut to change its alignment or shorten or lengthen it.

otic capsule.definicao: The bony shell that surrounds the inner ear.

otitis externa.definicao: An infection of the skin lining the ear canal of the outer ear. Also called swimmer’s ear.

otitis media.definicao: An infection of the middle ear.

otosclerosis.definicao: An abnormal bony growth in the middle ear that causes hearing loss.

outbreak.definicao: Synonymous with epidemic. Sometimes used to refer to a local epidemic as compared to a larger, general epidemic.

outer ear.definicao: The external part of the ear, as well as the external ear canal and the eardrum.

outpatient.definicao: A person who receives treatment at a hospital or other medical facility but does not stay overnight.

output.definicao: The loudest sound that a hearing aid can produce.

ovariectomy.definicao: Surgical removal of one or both ovaries.

overactive bladder.definicao: Frequent urination and urges to urinate.

overt proteinuria.definicao: A condition of declining kidney function. It is part of the progression of kidney disease, developing after microalbuminuria (when a damaged kidney begins to leak small amounts of a protein called albumin into urine) and before chronic kidney disease.

overweight.definicao: A body weight above the healthy range but not obese. Usually defined as a body mass index of 25 to 29.9.

ovulation.definicao: The release of a mature egg from the ovary, at which time it is available to be fertilized by sperm.

oxidant.definicao: An unstable molecule in the body that plays a role in aging and can damage tissue. Also known as a free radical.

oxidation.definicao: A process in which oxygen combines with a substance, altering its structure and changing or destroying its normal function.

oxygenated blood.definicao: Blood that has moved through the lungs where it has absorbed oxygen; oxygenated blood moves from the lungs into the heart, from which it is then pumped throughout the body.

pacemaker, artificial.definicao: A small electronic device generally placed in the chest to correct an irregular heartbeat. It generates small electrical pulses that prompt the heart to beat at a normal pace.

pacemaker, natural.definicao: A specialized cluster of cells called the sinoatrial node in the top of the right atrium. The pacemaker produces a steady flow of beat now signals that flash across the atria and then pass through the atrioventricular node to the ventricles.

pad.definicao: Abbreviation for peripheral artery disease, a condition caused by atherosclerosis in the arteries in the legs or leading to them.

palate.definicao: The tissues that make up the roof of the mouth.

palliative care.definicao: Treatment that relieves the symptoms of a serious illness, but does not cure the disease itself.

palpate.definicao: To examine a part of the body by touching it carefully.

palpitation.definicao: Sensation that the heart is beating rapidly or irregularly.

palsy.definicao: Paralysis in part of the body, often with loss of sensation and uncontrolled body movements.

pancreas.definicao: A gland in the abdomen that produces digestive enzymes and hormones.

pandemic.definicao: A disease outbreak affecting large populations or a whole region, country, or continent.

pannus.definicao: An abnormal layer of tissue that forms over joints or the cornea of the eye.

papillary muscles.definicao: Threads of muscle that pull the heart valves between the upper and lower chambers of the heart closed during heart contractions.

paraplegia.definicao: Paralysis of the legs and lower part of the body.

parasomnias.definicao: Sleep disorders, such as night terrors or sleep walking, that periodically interfere with sleep.

parasympathetic nervous system.definicao: Part of the nervous system that calms body systems excited by the stress hormones.

parathyroid glands.definicao: Glands responsible for releasing a hormone that controls calcium levels and influences bone loss and growth.

parathyroid hormone.definicao: A hormone that controls levels of calcium and phosphorous in the blood and influences bone loss and growth.

parietal lobe.definicao: Part of the brain. It plays a role in sensory processes, like pain and touch, and language.

parkinson's disease.definicao: A brain disorder that causes movement problems, including shaking, difficulty walking, and rigidity in muscles.

paroxysm.definicao: A sudden, violent attack or convulsion; or the worsening of symptoms or recurrence of disease.

paroxysmal hemicrania.definicao: A rare form of headache. Sufferers experience a severe throbbing, drilling pain on one side of the face or behind the eye.

passive immunity.definicao: Immunity that is conferred by another, such as a mother’s antibodies protecting her baby during gestation and shortly after birth.

patch test.definicao: A test used to diagnose whether a rash was caused by a reaction to certain allergens, such as poison ivy or a cosmetic ingredient, or an irritant such as soap.

patella.definicao: The medical name for your kneecap.

pathogen.definicao: A tiny organism such as a virus, bacterium, or parasite that can invade the body and produce disease.

pathology.definicao: The study of diseases and how they affect your body. A doctor who specialises in pathology is called a pathologist.

patient-controlled analgesia.definicao: A method that allows a person to control, within limits, the amount and timing of pain medication he or she receives. It is usually done by pressing a button to release the medication from a computerized pump into an IV.

pcos.definicao: Abbreviation for polycystic ovary syndrome, an inherited disorder characterized by the formation of abnormal cysts in enlarged ovaries; a leading cause of female infertility and a common cause of excess facial or body hair (hirsutism).

pde5 inhibitors.definicao: Abbreviation for phosphodiesterase type 5 inhibitors, drugs that can help a man achieve and maintain an erection.

peak bone mass.definicao: The greatest amount of bone tissue that a person has during his or her life.

peak flow.definicao: A measure of how fast a person can blow air out of the lungs.

peak flow meter.definicao: A device to assess lung function, often used to diagnose and monitor asthma.

pediculus humanus capitis.definicao: A blood-sucking parasite commonly known as the louse (plural, lice) that can cause an itchy scalp; infestations are highly contagious and especially common in school-age children.

pellagra.definicao: A rare disease brought on by severe niacin deficiency that causes diarrhea, dermatitis, and dementia.

penile prosthesis.definicao: An inflatable or bendable device that is implanted in the penis to allow a man with erectile dysfunction to have erections when he wishes.

pepsin.definicao: Enzymes secreted by the stomach to break down protein.

peptic ulcer.definicao: A raw, crater-like sore in the lining of the stomach or duodenum that causes burning stomach pain.

percutaneous diskectomy.definicao: Surgical removal of part of a spinal disk that is bulging out abnormally and pressing on a nerve root or the spinal column.

percutaneous electrical nerve stimulatio.definicao: A pain relief therapy that uses needles to deliver low-voltage electrical current under the skin to stop pain signals from reaching the brain.

percutaneous transluminal coronary angio.definicao: A procedure used to open blocked coronary arteries. A small, thin tube with a tiny balloon at its tip is inserted into a narrowed coronary artery. The balloon is then inflated to widen the narrowed area. A stent may be put in place to hold the artery open. Percutaneous transluminal coronary angioplasty is also known as balloon angioplasty.

perforation.definicao: A hole, such as an ulcer, in an organ or tissue.

performance anxiety.definicao: Concern about sexual performance that is so severe that it leads to sexual dysfunction.

perfusion.definicao: Passage of a fluid through a specific organ or an area of the body.

perfusion defect.definicao: A test result that indicates abnormal blood flow or areas of damaged or dead heart muscle.

pericarditis.definicao: Inflammation of the pericardium, the heart's sac-like covering.

pericardium.definicao: The fibrous sac that surrounds the heart and the roots of the major blood vessels.

perimenopause.definicao: The transition time in a woman’s life that begins when ovaries produce less estrogen and menstruation becomes less frequent, and ends when the ovaries no longer produce eggs and menstruation stops.

perineum.definicao: The area of skin between the vagina and anus in women, and between the scrotum and anus in men.

periodic limb movement disorder.definicao: A sleep disorder in which the legs jerk or cramp repeatedly during the sleep.

Traduções.pt: distúrbio periódico do movimento dos membros *
Traduções.es: trastorno del movimiento periódico de las extremidades *

periodization.definicao: An exercise strategy that varies reps, sets, and resistance to alternate heavier and lighter workouts over a period of time.

periodontal disease.definicao: Diseases, including gingivitis and periodontitis, that attack the gum tissue and the structures supporting the teeth. Also called gum disease.

periodontitis.definicao: An advanced stage of gum disease that attacks the teeth’s supporting structures.

peripheral artery disease.definicao: A condition caused by atherosclerosis in the arteries in the legs or leading to them.

peripheral nervous system.definicao: The parts of the nervous system outside of the brain, brain stem, and spinal cord.

peripheral neuropathy.definicao: Damage to the long nerves radiating from the spine to the arms and legs.

peripheral vascular disease.definicao: Narrowing of blood vessels that supply blood to the legs, arms, stomach, or kidneys.

peripheral vision.definicao: Side vision, or what the eye perceives outside the direct line of vision.

peristalsis.definicao: Wavelike movement of intestinal muscles that propels food through the digestive tract.

peritoneal dialysis.definicao: Treatment for kidney failure that uses a machine to remove toxins from the bloodstream.

peritonitis.definicao: Inflammation of the membrane that line the abdominal cavity and surrounds most abdominal organs.

pernicious anemia.definicao: A form of anemia in which red blood cells enlarge and decrease in size due to an inability to properly absorb vitamin B12.

personal emergency response system.definicao: A device worn around the neck or wrist that allows a person to call for help by pressing a button.

Traduções.pt: sistema pessoal de resposta a emergências *
Traduções.es: sistema personal de respuesta a emergencias *

pessary.definicao: A device placed in the vagina to support or correct the position of the uterus, rectum, or bladder.

pessimism.definicao: A characteristic frame of mind that leads a person to expect negative outcomes and to view the world as a negative or fearful place.

petechiae.definicao: Pinpoint-sized red or purple spots that appear in clusters on the skin, caused by bleeding under the skin.

pet scan.definicao: Abbreviation for positron emission tomography, a medical imaging test that uses a radioactive substance to assess organ and tissue function in the body and to look for disease.

peyronie’s disease.definicao: Scarring of some of the tissue inside the penis, causing the penis to bend at an angle during an erection.

ph monitoring.definicao: A test to determine whether stomach acid is backing up into the esophagus. For this test, a sensing probe is inserted through the nose and positioned above the lower esophageal sphincter.

phacoemulsification.definicao: A method of cataract removal. It uses ultrasound waves to break up the clouded lens of the eye so it can be suctioned out with a needle.

phagocytes.definicao: Cells that can ingest other cells, bacteria, and foreign particles.

phase shift disorder.definicao: Sleep problem that results when a person's internal clock becomes out of sync with external time. This can be a problem for people who work the night shift.

phase-2 enzyme.definicao: A helpful enzyme that seems to clear toxins and help prevent cancer-causing substances from binding to DNA.

phenothiazines.definicao: Powerful tranquilizing drugs used to treat schizophrenia and, sometimes, severe nausea.

phenylpropanolamine.definicao: A decongestant drug used to treat nasal congestion and sometimes mild incontinence.

pheochromocytoma.definicao: A rare adrenal gland tumor that secretes hormones that narrow blood vessels and increase blood pressure.

phlegm.definicao: Thick, sticky mucus secreted by mucous membranes, such as the sinuses.

phonophobia.definicao: Sensitivity to noise, often experienced during a migraine attack.

phosphodiesterase type 5.definicao: An enzyme that breaks down substances that help the penis become erect and maintain an erection.

photocoagulation.definicao: Use of a laser to seal off blood vessels.

photodynamic therapy.definicao: A medical treatment that uses a light source to activate a photosensitizing drug (one that becomes activated by light exposure). Often used in oncology, dermatology, and cosmetic surgery.

photophobia.definicao: Sensitivity to light, often experienced during a migraine attack.

photopsia.definicao: A sensation of sparks or flashes of light across the visual field.

photorefractive keratectomy.definicao: Laser surgery used to reshape the cornea in order to correct vision problems.

photorejuvenation.definicao: A cosmetic procedure that uses intense pulsed light to remove wrinkles and improve skin tone and texture.

physiatrist.definicao: A physician who specializes in physical medicine, pain, and rehabilitation.
